title: Shipping and Receiving Clerk
description:
**Location:**Garden City, NY, US, 11530
**Business Unit:** Treitler FMH
**Posting Date:** Sep 16, 2024
**Job Description:**Work Schedule: Monday-Friday, 7:00am-3:30pm  


**Position Summary:*** **This role performs a variety of operations connected with the receipt and shipment of products.**
* **Verify, record and deliver all** **incoming products**
* **Enter all receipts in oracle**
* **Unload all delivery trucks (forklift)**
* **outgoing shipments and prepare items for shipping. Compare identifying information and counts, weights or measure item to verify against invoices, orders or other records.**
  


**Supervisory Responsibilities:**
* None

  


**Duties and Responsibilities**:
* **Load and Unload Delivery Trucks**
* **Receive and deliver all incoming products**
* **Perform electronic inventory transactions**
* **Insert items into container, using spacers, fillers, protective passing or using Instapak Foaming Machine.**
* **Bind cartons using tape shooter.**
* **Stamp, stencil or glue identifying information and shipping instructions onto crates or containers.**
* **Post weights, shipping charges and affix postage.**
* **Operate tier-lift truck, forklift truck or use hand truck to move, convey or hoist shipments from packing area to shipping platform.**
* **Bind containers with metal tape, suing strapping machine.**
* **Perform electronic inventory trransactions to pull orders to ship.**
* **Navigate to and update customer portals as required daily.**
* **Prepare and type shipping and related documents, such as waybills, express delivery forms and government DD250 forms.**
* **Must have the ability to operate forklifts in a safe manner throughout the facility.**
* **Maintain and organize the work area to assure safe working conditions and support daily visual flow management guidelines.**
* **Perform, as assigned, other similar or related duties.**

  


**Required Skills and Abilities****:**
* Ability to use UPS/Fed-Ex transactions terminals
* Precise and effective phone communication skills
* Ability to work with minimal supervision.
* Self-Starter
* Ability to learn and apply new skills
* Accuracy important (systems transactions)
* Ability to interact with truck vendors

  


**Education and Experience:**
* High School Diploma or GED Certificate and equivalent experience (On the Job Training)
* PC with Windows, Oracle or Database experience is required
* Fluency in English Required

  


**Physical Requirements:*** Prolonged sitting, standing, and core-body movement required
* Ability to safely lift up to 70lbs, team lift over 70lbs required
* Due to contracts with the United States Government, the candidate must be either a United States Citizen or Green Card holder
Compensation


**Salary Minimum:** $30,000
**Salary Maximum:** $50,000
**Incentive:** No
Disclaimer: Where a specific pay range is noted, it is a good faith estimate at the time of this posting. The actual salary offered will be based on experience, skills, qualifications, market / business considerations, and geographic location.

title: CPG Sales & Merchandising Specialist
description:
**CPG Sales & Merchandising Specialist Empire City Brand Builders - New York, NY**

Are you passionate about consumer packaged goods (CPG) and have a knack for sales & merchandising? Do you thrive in a fast-paced, innovative environment? Empire City Brand Builders is seeking a dynamic CPG Sales & Merchandising Specialist to join our visionary team in the heart of New York City!

**About Us:**

Empire City Brand Builders is not your average sales and merchandising firm. We're a team of CPG enthusiasts who believe in the power of bold thinking and cutting-edge strategies. Our mission? To build towering successes for our clients' products in the competitive skyline of retail.

**What You'll Do:**

* Develop and execute innovative merchandising strategies for our diverse portfolio of CPG clients
* Collaborate with our creative team to design eye-catching in-store displays and promotions
* Build and maintain strong relationships with key retailers and decision-makers
* Analyze sales data and market trends to identify growth opportunities
* Participate in brainstorming sessions (often involving impromptu pitch contests and gourmet snack tastings)
* Represent our clients' products at trade shows and industry events (be prepared to charm and dazzle!)

**What We're Looking For:**

* Experience in CPG sales, merchandising, or related field
* A creative mind that can transform ordinary products into the talk of the town
* Strong communication skills and the ability to build rapport with clients and retailers
* Analytical skills to interpret sales data and translate it into actionable insights
* Adaptability and a sense of humor (essential for navigating both our dynamic industry and our lively office culture)
* Willingness to travel up to 95% of the time (we'll make sure you see the best of what each city has to offer)

**Perks & Benefits:**

* Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses
* Snacks and beverages (we're connoisseurs of the products we represent!)
* Monthly team outings and "market research" expeditions (exploring the latest trends in CPG)
* Professional development opportunities and mentorship programs

If you're ready to join a team that's building the future of CPG one innovative campaign at a time, we want to hear from you! Send us your resume, a cover letter explaining why you're the perfect fit for our ambitious crew, and your most creative product pitch (impress us with your ingenuity).

Empire City Brand Builders is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Apply now and let's build your career to new heights in the Empire State of mind!

title: Residential Maintenance Counselor; 4202-209-N
description:
**Click here to view our open opportunities:** Catholic Charities Brooklyn and Queens
  
  

For over 125 years, Catholic Charities Brooklyn and Queens has been providing quality social services to the neighborhoods of Brooklyn and Queens, and currently offers 160-plus programs and services for children, youth, adults, seniors, and those struggling with mental illness.
  
Brooklyn Community Living Programs provides services to adults with a severe mental illness, a DSM diagnosis is required for a client to be eligible for services and need of housing. Brooklyn, Queens and Jamaica Programs are scattered site housing and do not have clients living in one building.
  
  

**STATEMENT OF THE JOB:**  

The Agency has embraced the concept of a fully integrated system of care for all consumers of service. This requires that staff assess clients’ needs holistically and see it as their responsibility to connect the client with services needed both internal and external to the Agency, regardless of the door through which the consumer enters the system. All staff members are required to read and commit to fulfilling the Agency and BHS Mission Statement.
  
Under the Supervision of the Unit Supervisors and Clinical Manager, the Residence Maintenance Counselor has responsibility to maintain and complete minor repairs in apartments serviced, conducting apartments inspections, for assisting with the rehabilitation and recovery services offered to residents at Brooklyn Community Living program. The Residence Maintenance Counselor ensures the rights, safety and approved care of all clients by implementing best practices in accordance with regulations of the New York State Office of Mental Health and Department of Health & Mental Hygiene as well guidelines implemented by the Agency. The Residence Maintenance Counselor is required to maintain a professional and ethical disposition at all times.
  
* Coordinating daily operation of Supportive and Supported units.
* Coordinating activities regarding repairs/improvements with Housing Supervisor and Program Unit Supervisor of Residential Services, landlords, superintendents of buildings and vendors.
* Conducting monthly inspections to all apartments.
* Coordinating all arrangements needed for treatment of Bed bugs infestation.
* Ensuring that all existing units are cleaned and disinfected prior to new occupancy.
* Reporting to the Clinical Manager, Housing Coordinator and/or Unit Supervisor any conditions which may be hazardous to residents.
* Maintaining organization of all apartment charts, work orders completion and regular inspections documentation, smoke and carbon monoxide detectors charts.
* Maintaining hygiene standards beyond the landlord’s responsibility when it is required for emergency hygiene maintenance on a 24-hour basis.
* Documenting all visits, contacts and repair arrangements in AWARD electronic system.
* Ensure that all discharged charts have all necessary documentation and signatures
* Reporting to Behavioral Health Services Administration and/or Agency Administration issues that may have a negative impact on the reputation of the Agency, client and/or staff welfare or any corporate compliance issue.
* Cooperating with any and all investigations conducted by the Agency, funding sources and any other authorized agencies/entities.
* Assisting the maintenance staff with minor repairs and improvements to the residences when not otherwise provided by building management.
* Assisting residents with housekeeping, if required.
* Participating in the on-call duty roster for coverage, if required.
* Provision of coverage when required due to shortage of staff.
* Assisting client to establish new accounts for telephone and utilities in client name.
* Participating in the referral process to appropriate community service providers, providing the necessary linkage to psychiatric, rehabilitative, financial, medical and legal services to ensure quality resident care.
* Performs other related duties as requested or assigned.
* Assisting with submission and maintaining of CAIRS and LOS reports.
* Accompany clients to scheduled appointment with service providers, if needed.
* Assisting the Housing Coordinator of Residential Services to acquire apartments, as established by contract.


**QUALIFICATIONS:**  

* Bachelor’s Degree in Social Services, Mental Health, or a related discipline required.
* Previous experience working with people with mental disabilities preferred.
* Must be able to perform repairs and to share emergency on-call.
* Ability to work flexible hours, including weekends, evenings according to the needs of program operation.
* Excellent Computer skills & ability to travel throughout the five boroughs as needed.
* Ability to operate a computer keyboard, mouse, & office equipment.
* Ability to lift, carry, push, and/or pull weight up to 50 lbs.
* Able to mop, sweep, climb ladders, and use basic tools, maintenance tools and equipment.
* Ability to stand for longer periods of time; able to bend, kneel, and crouch.


**BENEFITS:**  

* We offer competitive salary and excellent benefits including:
* Generous time off (Vacation/ Personal Days/ Sick Days/ Paid Holidays annually)
* Medical,
* Dental
* Vision
* Retirement Savings with Agency Match
* Transit
* Flexible Spending Account
* Life insurance
* Public Loan Forgiveness Qualified Employer
* Training Series and other additional voluntary benefits.


For more information on our organization, please visit our website at: www.ccbq.org EOE/AA.

title: Home Care Nurse Case Manager
description:
**Job Summary**

Harmony Home Care is a rapidly growing Licensed Home Care Services Agency (LHCSA) based in Manhattan that is now hiring part-time nurse managers (**RN or NP**). The Company provides private pay home care services to older adults in Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, and the Bronx.

Our part-time nurse managers will be responsible for a series of field-based clinical tasks, as well as training and supervision of our home health aides and personal care aides. ***We are looking for candidates who can be available for two or three days each week***.

Harmony Home Care and its comanaged entity, Duet Care at Home, have become leaders in premium in-home care services in New York City. Our aide and companion workforce consists of both seasoned caretakers and curious, passionate individuals who are newer to the field. Some of them have worked as home health aides (HHAs) or certified nursing assistants, while others are artists, performers, graduate-level students, or semi-retired “encore” career professionals who simply want to make a difference in someone’s life.

We believe the personal connection between an older adult and the person supporting them is paramount. At the same time, we recognize the importance of clinical excellence when supporting clients who require assistance with ADLs and various chronic conditions.

You’ll find our workplace to be supportive and collaborative. We’re looking for more empathic and motivated professionals who want to make a difference in our employees’ and clients’ lives.

**Field Responsibilities** 

● Conduct patient assessments and develop personalized care plans.

● Perform clinical duties, as needed. Common tasks include monitoring vitals, medication pours, wound care, IV therapy, etc.

● Educate patients and families on disease management and treatment.

● Communicate with medical providers and agency staff to optimize outcomes and patient experience.

**Training & Supervision Responsibilities** 

● Provide supervision and assessment of paraprofessionals, including home health aides and personal care aides.

● Participate in staff training (e.g. proper transfer techniques or hoyer lift operation) and maintaining infection control standards.

**Preferences & Requirements**

● Current License to practice as a Registered Nurse or Nurse Practitioner

● Bachelor’s degree or higher is preferred

● CPR certification required

● Strong assessment and documentation skills

● 5-years practical nursing experience

● 3-years home health care experience

● Must be reliable, dependable and on time

● Current physical and screening

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $500.00 - $600.00 per day

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Nursing: 5 years (Required)
* Home health: 3 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* RN License (Preferred)

title: One on One Paraprofessional
description:
**Paterson Preparatory Charter School**

**Paraprofessional**

**Paterson Prep combines a Classical approach to education – an emphasis on an ennobling and content-rich curriculum, inductive inquiry-driven instruction, and virtue formation that fosters an encounter with Truth, Beauty, and Goodness – with co-teaching practices and individualized instructional support. We approach the formation of our students holistically and maintain high academic expectations. Ours is a joyful community that honors the dignity of each student, our staff members, and the families we serve.**

**Position Overview**

​​We are seeking a Paraprofessional to support classroom teachers and provide instructional and administrative assistance in our elementary school. The Paraprofessional will work under the direction of the classroom teacher and other school leaders to ensure that all students receive the support and resources they need to be successful.

This position requires an enthusiastic, flexible, solutions-oriented, organized, and creative educator prepared to challenge the educational status quo. Paterson Prep teachers must have a deep passion for student-engaged learning and a proven ability to manage multiple concurrent tasks and responsibilities, while inspiring outstanding achievement in children in a joyful and collaborative work environment.

**Core Competencies & Responsibilities**

* **​**Primary Function: To assist the teacher maintain an orderly, safe, and educational atmosphere in the classroom by supporting and supervising students
* Provides intensive individualized support services directed toward the development and/or enhancement of skills necessary for emotional, cognitive, behavioral, language, and interpersonal growth of the student
* Assist with classroom management, including behavior support and classroom organization.
* Accurately completes all required documentation and data collection
* Works with an individual student to reinforce learning of material or skills as described in the IEP/treatment plan
* Assists the teacher in devising special strategies for reinforcing material or skills based on a sympathetic understanding of the individual student, his/her needs, interests, and abilities
* Helps the student master equipment or instructional materials assigned by the teacher and assists the student throughout the school environment as necessary
* Assists with lunch, snack and cleanup routines as needed
* Alerts the regular teacher to any problem or special information about the individual student
* Collaborate with other Paraprofessionals and school leaders to support the school's mission and goals.
* Responsible to: Director of Special Services, Building Administration, and Classroom Teacher

**Qualifications**

* An unwavering, confident, and enthusiastic commitment to the educational mission of the Paterson Prep Schools Network in service to the school community.
* A relentless dedication to providing all students with an academically robust, inspiring, and joyful learning experience.
* Excellent spoken and written communication skills.
* Sixty (60) college credits; or Teacher Certification and experience; or receive passing score on the Paraprofessional Assessment
* Special Education credential and experience (highly desirable).

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $40,000.00 - $55,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: After-School Opportunity For Educators
description:
Are you currently working in an Education setting passionate about making a difference in children's lives? Maybe you're working for the Department of Education or a Private School as a teacher, teacher's assistant, or paraprofessional and looking for some additional work after 3 pm?


Channel that passion into a career that aligns with your skills and expertise. Join us in the Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) field, where your knack for working with children can bring about genuine change for those with Autism. Be a vital part of a community dedicated to enhancing lives.


**Perks:**


* Great opportunity for anyone in Education or related fields, as many positions offer afternoon or evening hours. Great role for Teachers, Teachers Assistants, and Paraprofessionals!
* Enjoy job security and advancement opportunities in the thriving ABA industry.
* Experience flexibility and autonomy in your schedule.
* Receive competitive compensation.
* Ideal for those seeking part-time positions.
* A fantastic entry point into the field of psychology, providing valuable real-world experience.
* No prior ABA experience needed; we provide comprehensive training.

**Responsibilities:**

* Provide one-on-one ABA services to clients, using evidence-based interventions supporting independence and positive behavior.
* Serve as an integral member of our clinical team, responsible for the direct implementation of skill-building and care plans.
* Record session data accurately using electronic devices.
* Foster a positive learning environment for clients and connect with families.
* Collaborate with families and BCBA Supervisor(s) to enhance treatment effectiveness.

**Qualifications:**


* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Willingness to learn and passionate about making a difference for children with Autism.
* Patience, compassion, and the ability to maintain a calm demeanor in challenging situations.

Need to Know:


* Services will be provided in clients' homes or in community-based locations.
* All positions start off part-time.
* Required to take the 40-hour Registered Behavior Technician course.
* Looking to hire candidates who are willing to make a 6-month commitment to change our clients lives.

Ready to leverage your educational skills to help more children? Apply today, join our team, and let your skills in the classroom make a positive impact on the lives of children with Autism.
company_description: Comprehensive provides autism therapy for children 2+ with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) or developmental challenges.

title: Credentialed Team Leader (Men's Residential)
description:
Are you passionate about making a difference in others' lives? Then come join the Straight and Narrow team!


Headquartered in Paterson, NJ, Straight and Narrow is the largest program of its kind. We provide innovative and compassionate services to individuals struggling with substance use and co-occurring disorders. We are looking for dedicated, caring and compassionate people to work in our Residential/Outpatient Treatment Facilities and Community Programs


**Credentialed Team Leader (Men's Residential Program)**


Hours: Monday - Friday (8:30am -4:30pm) (One Late Night 12:00pm-8:00pm)


Location: Paterson, NJ


**Sign on bonus of $3000 (Full time Only) (New Employees Only)**


Job Summary:


As a line counselor the team leader will provide leadership and oversight of specific program and clinical operations as instructed by the program’s clinical supervisor. Responsibilities will focus upon working with the clinical staff to ensure the provision of services based upon the organizations policies and procedures and licensing standards.


Duties to include, but not limited to:


Leadership Responsibilities:


Maintain a minimum case load as required by the level of care of the program assigned.


Supervise the counseling team as directed by the Clinical Supervisor or Director,


Provide oversight of the clinical coverage of services


Participate in Team meetings as scheduled.


Provide the Clinical Director with monthly reports on the status of the program.


Participate in program Strategic Planning process with the Clinical and Director and implement the strategic plan initiatives.


Plan, develop and initiate Program Development initiatives with the treatment team.


Participate in the design, and implementation of policies and procedures.


Finances:


Assist in the oversight and manage the submission of daily billing of services provided.


Human Resources:


Assist in the departmental orientation and training of the counseling staff and interns.


Assist in the development and implementation of a Volunteer Services Program.


Obtain/maintain appropriate licenses/certifications. Continue to pursue own professional development.


Programs:


Assist in the maintenance of county and state contracts as appropriate. Be available for necessary site visits.


Obtain and maintain appropriate licensure for Agency.


Work with Clinical Supervisor and Director on program development.


Make recommendations to clinical team regarding the admission of new residents.


Input client data into NJSAMS and monitor LOCI renewals as needed.


Facilitate groups and/or individual sessions (process and educational) as needed.


Ensure that individual clients are compliant with medical and psychiatric treatment recommendations and that this treatment is noted on client’s treatment plan.


Act as a member of the treatment team, providing clinical assistance to residents and


Actively participate in staff meeting, clinical team meeting, supervision


Continue to upgrade skills by attending relevant training and workshops.


Participate on at least one CQI committee.


Qualifications:


LCADC, CADC with MA/MSW/LAC/LSW or equivalent with at least 2 years’ experience in addictions treatment program experience; thorough understanding of the multiple needs of the substance uses disorder population and evidence-based treatment services.


Benefits:


For full time positions, we offer medical, vision, dental, life and supplemental life insurance. Accidental and Critical Illness Insurance, 403B with employer match, Paid Time off (PTO), in house training seminars, two training days for certified professionals. SN also offers supervision for those individuals trying to become licensed in NJ as a LCADC/CADC, LSW, LCSW, LAC, LPC and LMFT. We participate in employee discount programs such as the Working Advantage program.

title: Fully Remote Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)
description:
**We are seeking passionate** and **dedicated** BCBAs to join our mission of providing excellent ABA services to our clients! And while you guide our clients it is our **mission** to support you!


* **Opportunities** for career advancement. 5 of our clinical directors were promoted from within!

title: Analyst, Quantitative Research Group - Research
description:
*Over the last 20 years, Ares’ success has been driven by our people and our culture. Today, our team is guided by our core values – Collaborative, Responsible, Entrepreneurial, Self-Aware, Trustworthy – and our purpose to be a catalyst for shared prosperity and a better future. Through our recruitment, career development and employee-focused programming, we are committed to fostering a welcoming and inclusive work environment where high-performance talent of diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives can build careers within this exciting and growing industry.*
Job Description
Ares Management Corporation (NYSE: ARES) is a leading global alternative investment manager offering clients complementary primary and secondary investment solutions across the credit, private equity, real estate and infrastructure asset classes. We seek to provide flexible capital to support businesses and create value for our stakeholders and within our communities. By collaborating across our investment groups, we aim to generate consistent and attractive investment returns throughout market cycles. As of June 30, 2024, Ares Management Corporation's global platform had approximately $447 billion of assets under management, with approximately ~3,000 employees operating across North America, Europe, Asia Pacific and the Middle East. For more information, please visit www.aresmgmt.com.  

The Ares Quantitative Research Group (QRG) is a pioneer in the application of quantitative analytics to private markets. QRG works across asset classes – credit, private equity, private real estate, and infrastructure – to provide investible insights to Ares’ investment teams, to deepen relationships with Ares’ investors, and to help develop new products for the firm. The group is a leader in private market performance measurement, having played a key role in the development of Direct Alpha and Excess Value. It regularly deals with questions that are novel, taking advantage of Ares’ privileged access to data in private asset classes. QRG consists of two teams, Research and Software, and acts as a firm-wide hub, coordinating closely with quantitative resources that are embedded within Ares’ different investment teams.  

Primary Functions & Responsibilities* We are seeking an Analyst to join our Research team in New York City. Responsibilities include:
* Work with mathematical and statistical models to solve important problems in private market investing, including identifying return drivers and attributes of private market portfolios
* Participate in original research to answer novel questions and produce investible information across private market asset classes
* Help to evaluate clients’ private market portfolios, identifying opportunities for active management in order to achieve portfolio objectives
* Assist in the preparation of presentations for internal investment groups, external investors, and conferences
* Contribute to the design, development, and evaluation of proprietary software tools used in the assessment of private market investment opportunities

  

Qualifications
Experience Required:* Candidates for the Summer Analyst role must be pursuing a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university, preferably in a related field (finance, economics, math, statistics, data analysis) with an anticipated graduation date between December 2024 and August 2025


General Requirements:* A general understanding of Finance and a strong interest in financial markets
* Interest in private markets
* Proficiency of some selection of statistical tools such as Python, R, Stata or Matlab
* Strong financial analysis, writing, communication, and presentation skills
* Good working knowledge of Microsoft Excel
* The ability to work both independently and as a productive member of dynamic teams

  

Location: New York, NY  

Compensation: The total base salary (subject to change) is expected to be $120,000  

Accommodations: Relocation stipend
Reporting Relationships
Compensation
The anticipated base salary range for this position is listed below. Total compensation may also include a discretionary performance-based bonus. Note, the range takes into account a broad spectrum of qualifications, including, but not limited to, years of relevant work experience, education, and other relevant qualifications specific to the role.
$0.00 - $0.00
The firm also offers robust Benefits offerings. Ares U.S. Core Benefits include Comprehensive Medical/Rx, Dental and Vision plans; 401(k) program with company match; Flexible Savings Accounts (FSA); Healthcare Savings Accounts (HSA) with company contribution; Basic and Voluntary Life Insurance; Long-Term Disability (LTD) and Short-Term Disability (STD) insurance; Employee Assistance Program (EAP), and Commuter Benefits plan for parking and transit.
Ares offers a number of additional benefits including access to a world-class medical advisory team, a mental health app that includes coaching, therapy and psychiatry, a mindfulness and wellbeing app, financial wellness benefit that includes access to a financial advisor, new parent leave, reproductive and adoption assistance, emergency backup care, matching gift program, education sponsorship program, and much more.*There is no set deadline to apply for this job opportunity. Applications will be accepted on an ongoing basis until the search is no longer active.*

title: Sales Account Manager - Remote in NJ
description:
Optum Home & Community Care, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, is creating something new in health care. We are uniting industry-leading solutions to build an integrated care model that holistically addresses an individual’s physical, mental and social needs – helping patients access and navigate care anytime and anywhere.



We’re connecting care to create a seamless health journey for patients across care settings. Join us to start **Caring. Connecting. Growing together.**

  



The Sales Account Manager (SAM) is a field-based position charged with enrolling Medicare beneficiaries, residing in a skilled nursing facility into the UnitedHealthcare Institutional Special Needs Plan (ISNP).

  



If you are located in the state of New Jersey, you will have the flexibility to work remotely\\* as you take on some tough challenges.

  


**Primary Responsibilities:**


* Utilize the national sales model to generate leads and enroll beneficiaries into the UnitedHealthcare Nursing Home plan
* Develop and manage account specific strategies to educate and engage facility personnel, resulting in the generation of interested residents and/or families (responsible parties)
* Utilize traditional sales strategies to uncover needs and introduce features and benefits of the plan
* Generate enrollments consistent with targets established for the territory
* Document all activity to ensure compliance with Medicare Marketing Guidelines


You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

**Required Qualifications:**


* Appropriate state health insurance licensure within 90 days of hire date or the ability to obtain
* Ability to maintain licensure and product certification based on policies and procedures
* Sales experience in a B2C or B2B setting or experience working in a skilled nursing facility
* Demonstrated experience meeting or exceeding sales goals
* Demonstrated account management skills (including planning, documentation and measurement)
* Demonstrated ability to work a variety of hours, early morning, evenings and weekends, as required by various sales activities
* Maintain a state driver’s license or arrange for transportation in the field
* Willing or ability to travel 90% throughout the designated local territory


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* B2B and B2C experience
* Use of a CRM or the ability to show technical skills


* All employees working remotely will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy



**New Jersey Residents Only:** The salary range for this role is $50,000 to $115,000 annually. Role is also eligible to receive bonuses based on sales performance. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. UnitedHealth Group complies with all minimum wage laws as applicable. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.

  



*At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age,* *location* *and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized* *groups* *and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering* *equitable* *care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission**.*

  


*Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group* *is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employers and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

  

*UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates* *are required to* *pass a drug test before beginning employment.*
company_description: Optum is a health services and innovation company on a mission to help people live healthier lives and to help make the health system work better for everyone.

title: Care Specialist / Med Tech Needed!!
company: The Arbors Assisted Living Islandia West
description:
**Do you love Seniors? We do! If you do we would love for you to come work for us.**

**The Arbors Assisted Living is currently hiring Care Specialist!**

**Looking for Part-Time Care Specialist/ Med Tech, Days may Vary. Hours 7am-7pm & 7pm-7am.. Weekends A MUST!**

Job Responsibilities:

· Works in conjunction with the Wellness Director and Case Manager to assure the needs of the residents are being maintained.

· Receives daily work assignments from supervisor to assist in resident care.

· Receives verbal report from previous shift and provides verbal report to next shift regarding special events; changes in resident’s condition.

· Identifies emergency situations and responds with appropriate measures including immediately notifying Wellness Director or Supervisor.

· Reports to the Wellness Director or Supervisor any observation of unusual appearance of behavior of residents (i.e. skin changes, restlessness, lethargy, mobility, change in continence, etc.)

· Respects resident privacy by knocking and waiting for acknowledgement before entering residents room, by pulling curtains or blinds and by shutting doors to provide privacy when treating residents or assisting with ADL’s; treats residents with dignity; explains procedures to resident before assisting him/her.

· Maintains confidentiality of necessary information.

· Creates and maintains an atmosphere of warmth, personal interest and positive emphasis as well as a calm environment throughout the community.

· Adheres to Customer Service Principles: respect, flexibility, knowledge, professionalism, pleasant attitude, patience and helpfulness. All responses should be timely, professional, caring and respectful.

· Cooperates and communicates with all staff in the community in a polite, courteous and positive manner.

· Works collaboratively with fellow employees to achieve goals and support Wellness Director.

· Seeks additional assignments when work is completed.

***Adaptability to Change/Flexibility:***

· Able to deal with multiple, competing demands.

· Able to take on new tasks and responsibilities when necessary

· Welcomes constructive change.

· Adapts well to new policies.

· Is effective in incorporating new ideas.

· Adjusts and adapts to community as well as departmental changes.

***Task Specific – General:***

· Assists residents with Activities of Daily Living, (ADL’s) personal care, including but not limited to nails, hair, oral hygiene, toileting, bathing, transferring, dressing and undressing as needed.

· Checks for clean clothes and ensures that residents are properly groomed and clean. Assists residents with clothing changes as necessary.

· Assists residents with managed incontinence program including toileting assistance, changing and managing incontinence briefs.

· Maintains knowledge of resident’s needs at all times. Notes any significant changes in the condition of residents and takes appropriate action. Identifies emergency situations and responds with appropriate measures.

· Reviews 24–hour log regularly.

· Completes resident evaluations as required.

· Checks residents regularly to assure that personal care needs are met.

· Assures that residents are familiar with call bell system.

· Answers emergency call light promptly and with courtesy.

· Follows through with resident problems or needs by reporting to supervisor depending upon level of ability and nature of resident need.

· Monitors residents’ attendance at meals and completes resident accountability report throughout the day.

· Assists when required in serving in resident dining room and resident snacks.

· Assists Wellness Director in monthly weight recording as required.

· Takes residents’ temperatures as directed by Wellness Director.

· Encourages participation of the resident in activities planned and provided by the Community.

· Assists with recreational activities including effectively leading an activity as required.

· Brings residents to and from meals and activities when necessary.

· Prepares resident laundry for pick up and puts clean laundry in appropriate closets/dresser when residents need assistance.

· Maintains residents’ rooms and common areas in a neat and orderly fashion including the making of beds and light housekeeping as needed.

· Obtains specimens for laboratory while observing infection control protocols.

· Utilizes supplies and equipment properly and without waste.

· Follows all established Arcadia policies and procedures as well as adheres to New York State Department of Health regulations.

· Adheres to established infection control procedures including but not limited to the washing of hands before and after caring for each resident.

***Safety:***

· Reports unsanitary conditions to appropriate personnel but will clean unsanitary condition to avoid any potential problem as may be necessary.

· Reports observations concerning hazardous conditions including structural, equipment and furniture defects to appropriate personnel.

· Follows all safety, fire and emergency procedures.

***Development/Education:***

· Attends and participates in scheduled in-service programs and staff development programs.

· Attends regularly scheduled staff meetings.

· Attends and participates in a minimum of 12 hours of in-service education.

***Time &Attendance:***

· Arrives at work on time and is prepared to perform duties as specified and at specified times.

· Reports for work dressed appropriately in clean, neat uniform with name badge.

· Reports for work neatly groomed.

title: Construction Project Manager
description:
*At Kushner, we pride ourselves on our four core values: Be Caring, Be Best in Class, Be Solution-Oriented, and Be Accountable. Our values represent what we strive to achieve every day. Every decision we have to make is guided by the “4 Be’s”. Our team and passion for the real estate industry exemplifies what it means to live out these core values in our offices and at our communities day in and day out. Each new day is a learning experience at Kushner, whether it is the knowledge we bring, gain, or share during our journey together. Our team members are set up to aim beyond, achieve the utmost success, and for endless possibilities for growth. Come Grow With Us!*

**Job Summary:**

This is a Project Manager (PM) position that represents the project Owner and the GC. The PM will be responsible for performing tasks consisting of monitoring, reviewing construction contracts, evaluating and tracking change order requests, tracking and following up on RFIs, analyzing budget modifications and anticipated cost reports, generating project schedule and cost updates and reporting on various aspects of the project, generating punch lists, following-up on punch list completion status with regular reports, and other tasks that may be assigned to ensure the project is built on schedule, within budget and in accordance with plans and specifications. The position requires attention to detail, very good time management skills to meet deadlines, strong communication skills both verbal and writing, and general good business management acumen.

**WORK HOURS:**

Weekdays 7 am to 5 pm; Saturdays 7 am- 1pm, as required.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

Project Manager, with all aspects of project from inception thru completion:

a) assists with preconstruction efforts including but not limited to permitting, trade contract review, analysis, tracking & reporting, bid packages analysis, review, reporting.

b) manages all aspects of the project from inception thru completion including the CO (Certificate of Occupancy) process.

c) prepares and executes a construction plan.

d) attends and leads project field meetings, provide minutes of meetings, develop follow-up lists

e) enforces safety on the job.

f) ensures that the required personnel and workers are on the job, checks what specific tasks they are performing, and checks this against job sheets given daily by the superintendent.

g) plans and tracks material delivery and scheduling with job superintendent.

h) prepares an initial review of change order requests form the subcontractors and provides periodic reporting of the change order request log to upper management for review and execution as needed

i) makes out delivery schedules, using a bar graph method or critical path method. Makes sure that the shop items are on the bar graph or CPM.

j) establishes delivery time for materials, equipment, or labor, based on when they will be required and when they can be acquired, and determines the lead time required for acquisition.

k) serves in quality control capacity, making sure that the materials used are those specified for the project, and work performed by subcontractors complies with the drawings.

l) keeps records of all deliveries.

m) keeps track of equipment

n) reads prints, noting discrepancies in the field hence issuing RFIs for clarification

o) follows up on shop drawings, submittals, or the detailed drawings of project.

p) maintains constant follow-up with sub-contractors to ensure that schedule is accomplished.

q) makes sure all federal, state, and local codes applicable to the project are adhered to,

r) makes sure all code required inspections, including 3rd party inspections, are performed, and completed successfully

s) makes sure all code required tests are performed and that results meet codes and specifications

**Pre-Requisites:**

· Requires Architect, Engineering, Construction Management or related Bachelor’s degree or equivalent years of related experience.

· Requires 5+ years of experience in Stick frame Multi-Family Residential Construction.

· Knowledge of Revu Bluebeam/AutoCAD is a must.

· Requires working knowledge of various construction disciplines, cost control, scheduling, safety regulations, engineering drawings and other documents required.

· Requires superior communication and interpersonal (tact, diplomacy, influence, etc.) skills essential both within the internal project team and externally with consultants

· Requires knowledge of the shop drawing submittal process.

· Requires the ability to read and comprehend building plans and specifications and able to comprehend and recognize safety standards and issues.

· Requires the ability to identify and report clearly critical deadlines.

· Requires understanding of construction contracts, retention, releases.

· Requires the ability to interact with all levels of personnel.

· Understanding of critical path construction scheduling.

description:
**Tumi Overview:**

**https://careers.samsonite.com/#en/sites/CX\\_1/job/3113/?utm\\_medium=jobshare**

*Since 1975, TUMI has been creating world-class business and travel essentials, designed to upgrade, uncomplicate, and beautify all aspects of life on the move. Blending flawless functionality with a spirit of ingenuity, we’re committed to empowering journeys as a lifelong partner to movers and makers in pursuit of their passions. Designed in America, for Global Citizens everywhere. The brand is sold globally in over 75 countries through more than 1,900 points of sale. For more about TUMI, visit* www.TUMI.com*.*

**Brand Detail:**

**INTEGRITY**

Our standards are exceptional, and we stand by everything we do.

**PASSION**

We treat our products, people and clientele with the total dedication they deserve.

**INNOVATION**

When it comes to forward thinking, we are foremost.

**GLOBALISM**

We are all Global Citizens and look to contribute to a global community.

**ENTREPRENEURIAL SPIRIT**

Each of us is empowered to create personal and collective progress.

**Position Summary:**

As part of our Retail team, the Associate Manager is responsible for creating a client experience that accurately reflects the ethos of our brand while building and maintaining strong client relationships and driving sales through outstanding service. The ideal candidate is committed to client service, demonstrating a strong understanding of, if not passion for, the luxury, travel, fashion, and lifestyle markets. The TUMI retail environment encourages an entrepreneurial spirit, offering growth opportunities over time as we work together to increase sales, KPI’s, build client awareness, provide world-class service, and grow the brand.

**Key responsibilities:**

* Manages and coordinates the daily activities of the store and the daily activities of the sales staff while ensuring all are engaged in promoting and selling products to ensure client satisfaction.
* Ensures each client receives outstanding client service; greets and acknowledges every client and develops new client relationships to increase sales and build brand loyalty.
* Ensures our clients receive superior after sales service.
* Attains monthly sales goal and delivers increases in other KPI goals (conversion, UPT and DPT).
* Assists the Store Manager and Assistant Manager with training sales associates.
* Merchandises store as directed by visual guidelines and ensures that all stock is well maintained and in good condition.

**Qualifications:**

To be a great fit for the TUMI retail team, you:

* Understand the TUMI brand and have true passion for the lifestyle, clients, and product assortment
* Are a team player who values a collaborative environment
* Possess a “client first” service mentality
* Have strong sales and client experience, particularly in the luxury market
* Can demonstrate proven success in meeting sales goals and achieving KPI’s
* Have a strong sense of integrity and an ability to lead by example

title: Shift Leader
description:
**SMASHBURGER**

**Shift Leader**


Our first Smashburger restaurant opened in 2007 with one single notion in mind; **to serve a better burger**! Better burgers takes better service, support and teamwork. That's why we treat our team members fairly in a diverse and safe environment. With an average of 10 restaurants opening each year, we invest in building internal opportunities for our teams’ learning and growth.” **We just build better**. Better Burgers. Better Teams. Better Experiences.

 **Better Benefits: Build a better experience work & lifestyle!**

* Tip share-earn up to $2/hr. extra in tips
* Get Paid $ to Refer your Friends\\*
* RGMs, RMs, & SLs are entitled to one (1) free meal each shift they work \\*
* Flexible schedules in a fun, family friendly, team environment
* Medical, Dental and Vision Options\\*\\*
* Paid time off – vacation and sick\\*\\*
* 401K match (21 and older)
* Employee Assistance Program
* Fast track for career opportunities and management experience
* Free uniform

*\\*\\*Eligibility based off of time in position and average hours worked*

* *Referred Employees Must Be in Good Standing & Referee must be employed with Smashburger at time of payout. Bonus is paid in two distributions*

 **Shift Leader Responsibilities**

* Reporting to the Restaurant General Manager, our Shift Leaders are the champions of better burgers! In this role you will:
* Manage the performance of both FOH & BOH employees
* Promote a fun and positive work environment
* Manage the effectiveness of people focused processes and systems
* Provide initial and ongoing training to all employees within the unit utilizing SmashConnect, LMS, and 4 step method of training
* Reward and recognizes employee performance that exceeds company standards
* Manage with integrity the daily completion of operational check lists to include
* Line checks and uniform standards
* Opening/closing check lists
* Safe and deposit logs
* Manage the guest experience metrics (NPS and OSAT)
* Manage FSC operational standards daily
* Ensure all food safety standards are followed & in compliance with local health depts.
* Exemplify guest service on each shift of the day and communicates SIZZLE service standards to the employees
* Manage the successful onboarding and training for all new employees
* Follow COGS management procedures for food ordering and inventory
* Follow company cash policies to ensure minimal losses through theft or shortages
* Manage daily labor

 **Shift Leader Requirements**

* Previous Shift Leader Experience
* 90-day completion of train the trainer course
* Flexible to work nights, weekends, and holidays
* Follow Smashburger uniform standards
* Ability to follow all guidelines and procedures set forth by Smashburger, local, state, and federal employment regulations
* Must successfully complete Smashburger training program
* Possess strong communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively communicate with restaurant management, front line employees and corporate support teams
* People management skills to effectively select, assess, coach/counsel, develop, motivate, and lead restaurant teams
* Excellent attention to detail
* Proven time management, consistency, and organizational skills
* Highly motivated, self-directed, and results driven
* Physical ability to stand for extended periods of time and to move and lift boxes of food/ supplies up to 50 lbs.
* Ability to work in high temperatures

  



*All applicants and employees have an equal opportunity for employment and advancement within Smashburger. Smashburger is dedicated to the principles of equal employment opportunity. We prohibit unlawful discrimination against applicants, prospective applicants, or employees on the basis of age 40 and over, race, sex, color, religion, national origin, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other applicable status protected by state or local law. This prohibition includes unlawful harassment based on any of these protected classes. Unlawful harassment includes verbal or physical conduct which has the purpose or effect of substantially interfering with an individual’s work performance or creating an intimidating, hostile, or offensive work environment. We maintain a workplace free of racial slurs and bias. This policy applies to all employees, including managers, supervisors, co-workers, and non-employees such as customers, clients, vendors, consultants, etc. Any conduct in violation of these company policies is also a violation of the law. Employees who engage in, ratify, or perpetuate discrimination, harassment or retaliation will be subject to disciplinary action, up to and including immediate discharge.*

title: District Manager
description:
**Reports to**: Director of Operations


With a projected 1,000 cafes in the United States by 2030, Paris Baguette is one of the fastest-growing neighborhood bakery cafés in the world. Our vision is to reestablish the neighborhood bakery café as the heart of the community around the world. Paris Baguette’s mission is to bring expertly crafted baked and brewed goods through a warm and welcoming bakery café experience that delivers joy to everyone.

  

If you are someone who has heart, wants to spread joy, nourish community and is ready to rise to the occasion, we are looking for you to join our growing team!

**WHAT WE ARE HUNGRY FOR**

  

As the District Manager, you will be responsible for maximizing the district’s revenue and cash flow growth by efficient use of people, processes, and planning. You will be responsible for the development of Managers and team members to deliver an experience that exceeds guest expectations for enjoyment and value. The ideal candidate will support our vision to re-establish the neighborhood bakery café as the heart of the community around the world by providing leadership and vision to the District management staff.


**KNOWLEDGE AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

  

* Recruits, selects, hires and trains cafe managers who are passionate about delivering the desired guest experience and achieving profitability goals.
* Identifies the training needs of cafe managers; conducts one-on-one or class training as appropriate; follows up with mentoring and support.
* Sets goals with cafe managers; conducts performance evaluations and skills assessments; creates career development plans, and prepares succession plans.
* Continually inspects the district’s operational and guest service standards; consistently communicates standards to cafe managers and ensures execution at café level.
* Proactively meets or exceeds guest experiences; deals promptly with complaints received.
* Consistent with the District plan, ensures cafe managers have specific, focused and well-executed sales and marketing plans. Evaluates cafe financial progress and performance and helps to develop action plans accordingly.
* Ensures adherence to policies and procedures for alcoholic beverage sales and consumption, food safety and health/sanitation. Ensures that policies and procedures are in compliance with organization’s policies and with all local and state regulations.
* Utilizes preventive maintenance programs to maintain cafe facilities. Proposes major capital projects in the budgeting process; works with the region facilities manager to complete approved projects.
* Ability to work varying shifts, weekends and holidays, as well as, extended workdays to support business needs.
* Other duties may be assigned.


**WHAT YOU NEED TO HAVE**


* At least 3-5 years related experience in high-volume retail, entertainment, hospitality, or restaurant venue required.
* At least 3-5 years of progressive management experience supervising several departments and staff of 50 or more employees required.
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent preferred.
* Basic working knowledge of POS register systems; experience utilizing MS Office suite, internet and related PC based systems.
* Possesses basic business math and strong analytical/decision- making skills, a high level of profit and loss capability, as well as sales and marketing skills and abilities.
* Willing to work a flexible schedule - including holidays, early mornings, nights, and / or weekends.
* Flexible, adaptive, upbeat, open and visible management style, with a successful record of accomplishment of managing senior operations leaders across a large geographically decentralized portfolio.
* Passion for people! Dynamic and engaged leader who has a passion for empowering, inspiring, motivating & developing team members.
* Exceptional organizational and communication skills with the ability to effectively balance priorities and deliver results in a fast-paced, ever-changing, and highly entrepreneurial environment.
* Feedback is a gift! Ability to provide constructive feedback and recognition to every member of the organization, to ensure we have an open and transparent culture of high performance standards.
* High emotional intelligence with the ability to work with, and manage diverse teams by being highly empathetic, intuitive, self-motivated and driven.
* Teams Win! Has to be a team player who fosters a collaborative and engaged teamwork environment.
* Being a Brand Ambassador, with an excellent knowledge of and commitment to Paris Baguette’s Mission, Vision, Brand Values and Culture.
* Love of travel! Ability to commute to all current Corporate and Franchise locations, as well as proposed openings.


**SWEET BENEFITS**


* Competitive compensation
* Free Cake for your Birthday
* Medical, Dental, Vision benefits
* 401K Retirement Plan
* Paid time off, paid Holidays
* High Performance Culture

title: Cashier ($400 Hiring Incentive!)
description:
Family owned and operated for over **50 years**, Mamoun’s Falafel is the oldest falafel restaurant in NYC and one of the first Middle Eastern brands in the country.

  

Our culture is driven by the legacy established by our founder, Mamoun, whose commitment to excellence and passion for hospitality transformed a small, hole-in-the-wall eatery into a premier falafel brand and a NYC landmark. Our mission is to serve fresh, authentic Middle Eastern food as quickly and as friendly as possible while creating an atmosphere that is energetic, upbeat, welcoming, and responsive for both guests and staff.

  

We are looking for **Cashiers** to join our team. Our **cashiers** are the ambassadors of our restaurants and handle all major aspects of our customer service, including taking orders and communicating with our guests, packaging and handing off orders, and keeping the restaurant clean while assisting fellow FOH team members.

  

**Why work at Mamoun’s?**

* **Great Pay** – our pay rates start at $15.50 per hour **PLUS** an extra $2-$3 per hour in tips!

* **$400 Signing Bonus** – receive **$200 after your first 30 days** (based on at least 100 total hours worked) and an additional **$200 after 60 days** (based on at least 200 total hours worked). *(Only available for first time hires.)*

* **Work Anniversary Bonus!** Paid each year on your anniversary - you will receive an extra week’s pay calculated by multiplying your average weekly hours for the year by your current pay rate.

* **Referral Bonus** – receive $200 when you refer someone through our referral program.

* **Paid Breaks with Free Shift Meals**

* **No prior experience necessary** - our training program will teach you everything you need to know and set you up for success.

* **Growth opportunities** – enter our development program and become the next Team Member promoted to **Team Leader**, **Assistant Manager**, or **General Manager**! And if you love training people, become an **in-store trainer** with the opportunity to support a **New Store Opening** (get to travel)!

* **Develop life skills** - we focus on developing our team members so that their success at Mamoun’s will translate into success in other areas of life, including other career or work opportunities.

  

**Job Requirements**

  

* Available to working during the day (10 am - 4 pm)
* Positive and friendly attitude
* Ability to speak, see, hear, read, and write
* Ability to multi-task (perform multiple functions at the same time)
* Ability to bend, stoop, stand, and walk for extended periods of time
* Ability to lift and carry at least 30 lbs and perform other diverse physical tasks as needed
* Develop thorough knowledge of our menu (taught during training)
* Execute standard operating procedures for all FOH positions (taught during training)
* Execute opening and closing checklists (taught during training)

  

Learn more about Mamoun’s by visiting our website at www.mamouns.com.

  

Mamoun’s Falafel is an **Equal Opportunity** employer.

title: Academic and ADHD Coach
description:
Are you passionate about empowering students with ADHD to reach their full potential? Join Grayson Executive Learning, a fully remote, boutique coaching company that values flexibility, competitive pay, and making a meaningful impact. Here’s why you’ll love working with us.

**Why You’ll Love Working with Us:**

* This is a 100% remote position and offers flexible scheduling.
* Competitive pay: $45 - $60 per hour based on experience (5-15 hours per week).
* Join a team that’s dedicated to supporting students and changing lives!
* Get professional development and training in evidence-based coaching methods.

**Qualifications**

We’re looking for professionals who *get it* – who understand the unique challenges students with ADHD face and are ready to make a real difference.

*What We’re Looking For:*

* 8+ years of experience (Special Ed Teachers, School Psychologists, Learning Specialists—We’re looking at you!)
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree or higher in Education or a related field
* Tech-savvy with platforms like Zoom, Google Suite, and Canvas
* Secret Keyword: Change

*Your Role:*

* Work 1:1 with students (5–15 hours a week, Monday–Thursday)
* Help them master time management, organization, and study skills
* Collaborate with educators and therapists to support each student’s success

**Personal Qualities**

*What We’re Looking For:*

* Empathy: You get students who struggle and want to help them succeed.
* Growth Mindset: You love learning, growing, and improving your skills.
* Connection: Building relationships with students comes naturally to you.
* Bonus: You’re patient and supportive—even when students struggle with social skills.

**Hiring Process:**

* Submit your resume, cover letter, and application
* Qualified candidates will be contacted via email to schedule a screening interview (done over Zoom)
* Candidates that advance past the screening interview will be invited to a final interview

**Who We Are**

At Grayson Executive Learning, we’re more than just coaches—we’re passionate advocates for students with ADHD and focus and organization challenges. Through our personalized, research-based approach, we help students not only improve their academic performance but also build confidence and self-belief. Every success story is a reminder that with the right support, students can overcome obstacles and achieve their full potential. If you’re ready to join a team that’s dedicated to changing lives, we’d love to hear from you! Apply today!

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $45.00 - $60.00 per hour

Expected hours: 5 – 15 per week

* Does your afternoon and evening schedule fluctuate throughout the school year (i.e. due to seasonal sports coaching or any other seasonal obligations?)
* What is the secret keyword in the job listing?
* Do you reside in the state of New York? (This position is for NY residents only)

title: Managed Care Coordinator I
company: Horizon Blue Cross Blue Shield of New Jersey
description:
Horizon BCBSNJ employees must live in New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania, Connecticut or Delaware
Job Summary:
This position supports the Clinical Operations functions and acts as a liaison between Members, Physicians, Delegates, Operational Business members and Member Service Coordinators
Responsibilities:* Performs review of service requests for completeness of information, collection and transfer of non-clinical data, and acquisition of structured clinical data from physicians/patients.
* Prepare, document and route cases in appropriate system for clinical review. Initiates call backs and correspondence to members and providers to coordinate and clarify benefits.
* Upon completion of inquiries initiate call back or correspondence to Physicians/Members to coordinate/clarify case completion.
* Reviewing professional medical/claim policy related issues or claims in pending status.
* Acts as liaison with providers, members and Care Managers.
* Perform other relevant tasks as assigned by Management.


Utilization Management:* Upon collection of clinical and non-clinical information MCC can authorize services based upon scripts or algorithms used for pre-review screening.
* Non Clinical staff members are not responsible for conducting any UM review activities that require interpretation of clinical information.
* Handles initial screening for pre-certification requests from physicians/members via incoming calls or correspondence based on scripts and workflows, and under the oversight of clinical staff.


Case Management:* Assists members with finding providers, resolving problems and answering questions regarding anything from how to obtain services to how to file an appeal.
* Makes outbound calls to in order to engage members in Case Management and to complete the necessary health assessment(s) (IHS/HRA, CNA/CMNA, MLTSS Elig Survey\\*.)
* Educates members regarding preventive health activities and services.
* Assists member to make appointments with their PCP, specialists, and/or transportation, etc. Handle PCP, demographic changes and/or new ID cards as requested by members.
* Triage and distribute referrals from Member Services and incoming faxes from providers.
* Reviews medical, dental and vision claims and address gaps in member's preventative care.

description:

Job Summary:
This position is responsible for performing RN duties using established guidelines to ensure appropriate level of care as well as planning for the transition to the continuum of care. Performs duties and types of care management as assigned by management. Serves as mentor/trainer to new RN's and other staff as needed. Subject matter expert for the various projects and committees as needed.
Responsibilities:* Assesses patient's clinical need against established guidelines and/or standards to ensure that the level of care and length of stay of the patient are medically appropriate for inpatient stay.

* Coordinates and assists in implementation of plan for members.

* Acts as subject matter expert for respective area for projects.
* May assume leadership type activities in team leads absence.
* Represent clinical teams within committee meetings

* Subject matter expert for user acceptance testing for medical management system.

title: Pharmacy Specialist I
company: Horizon Blue Cross Blue Shield of New Jersey
description:
Horizon BCBSNJ employees must live in New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania, Connecticut or Delaware
Job Summary:
This position is responsible for receiving verbal and written requests for prior authorization from pharmacists, physicians and/or members. They are accountable for supporting and assisting in the coordination of Pharmacy Services benefits, including claim utilization analysis, prescription plan design, ad-hoc reporting, correspondence and special projects. This position must ensure performance is in compliance with organizational or departmental goals and in compliance with regulatory agencies. They must process prior authorization requests received via fax or prior authorization help line, by evaluating the medical necessity/appropriateness for specific drugs and based on clinical criteria.
Responsibilities:* Responsible for all telephonic interaction with members, physician office staff, pharmacies and internal stakeholders for Pharmacy eligibility, coverage determination, and/or claim issues.
* Engagement with physicians & pharmacists to conduct effective interventions through clinical therapeutic interchange to facilitate formulary compliance, optimize generic dispensing, and consistency with the current plan design.
* Capture accurate and comprehensive clinical information for Prior Authorization requests from physicians and/or medical office staff to allow for clinical review and medical necessity determination.
* Responsible for satisfying all departmental customer service quality metrics while ensuring that all DMAHS and DOBI required regulatory turnaround times are consistently satisfied
* Process complaints, appeals, grievances, executive inquiries and compliance related issues.
* Responsible for identifying via interactions with members and providers, instances of potential fraud, waste, and abuse and resulting internal referrals that are necessary.
* Provide recommendations to increase efficiency, accuracy and productivity in the department.
* Process ad hoc request for information or reports from stakeholders.
* Accountable for independent and group learnings to ensure understanding of pharmacy services procedures and workflows.
* Assist in the day-to-day business functions of the pharmacy department as well as the Medication Therapy Management program.
* Provide support to various clinical programs within the pharmacy department.

title: Associate General Counsel - Private Wealth and Trust Services
description:
Summary:
The Associate General Counsel – Private Wealth will play an integral role within Neuberger Berman’s Legal & Compliance Department, specifically with respect to the Private Wealth business. The ideal candidate will have experience in private wealth legal and compliance issues, possess excellent organizational skills and strong written and oral communication skills, and be able to interface with various colleagues and business groups across the firm. This job will require strong writing and reading skills and the ability to think critically, issue spot, and efficiently review a variety of marketing literature.
Responsibilities:* Provide strategic advice on legal and regulatory issues affecting the Private Wealth business including: advising on the legal and regulatory framework for the Private Wealth business; liaising with wealth advisors, portfolio managers and operations on all aspects of the client relationship; and assisting with legal issues around client account opening and maintenance.
* Provide advice regarding regulatory matters appropriate for a wealth management and asset management business, including the Investment Advisers Act, FINRA rules, Investment Company Act, Securities Act, and ERISA, and serve as the lead attorney and work with various colleagues to implement changes to the business in order to comply with changing regulations.
* Partner with business, operational and risk teams through all stages of the development of new advisory initiatives, including drafting and updating advisory agreements, drafting fund offering documents relating to private funds offered through the Private Wealth channel, and advising on and testing technology initiatives.
* Provide bank regulatory level advice to Neuberger Berman’s trust company and ensure that the trust company’s fiduciary responsibilities are properly discharged.
* Review and approve marketing materials and other client communications to ensure that they comply with regulatory requirements and internal compliance policies; assist in the review and maintenance of standard materials (firm materials, pitch books, factsheets, team pages, and biographies).
* Effectively and diplomatically manage competing priorities and provide guidance with respect to the regulatory requirements and our fiduciary responsibility to clients to the portfolio management teams, the sales teams and other firm personnel.
* Develop, implement, update and maintain monitoring processes to ensure ongoing compliance and anticipate, manage, and reduce risk with respect to all aspects of the advisory business.


Qualifications:* At least five years of experience in-house at an asset management firm, or in the asset management group at a law firm with significant private wealth clients
* Strong writing and analytical skills
* Prior trust company experience a plus
* Efficient and resourceful, able to work independently, handling multiple and changing priorities, and meet deadlines
* Excellent organizational skills; detail oriented
* Strong time-management skills; ability to prioritize multiple tasks efficiently
* Resourceful and able to handle multiple and changing priorities
* Ability to communicate effectively with senior management


Compensation Details
The salary range for this role is $175,000-$250,000. This is the lowest to highest salary we in good faith believe we would pay for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range, and the range may be modified in the future. This range is only applicable for jobs to be performed in New York City. An employee’s pay position within the salary range will be based on several factors including, but limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, geographic location, performance, shift, travel requirements, sales or revenue-based metrics, any collective bargaining agreements, and business or organizational needs. This job is also eligible for a discretionary bonus. We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance, 401(k), life insurance and other benefits to eligible employees.
Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, production, or any other form of compensation that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.*Neuberger Berman is an equal* *opportunity/affirmative* *action employer. The Firm and its affiliates do not discriminate in employment because of race, creed, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship status or protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state, or federal laws, rules, or regulations. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact* *onlineaccommodations@nb.com**.**Learn about the* *Applicant Privacy Notice**.*

title: Social Media Associate
description:
Summary
As our Social Media Associate, you will help enable and implement the overall social media strategy for the firm and will be responsible for developing and curating engaging content for social media platforms. This individual will assist in the creation and editing of written, video, and photo content across a variety of marketing initiatives and platforms, including company events to gather live social media content. The ideal candidate is a professional, highly organized, and detail-oriented individual with a passion for social media.
Qualifications* Bachelor's degree
* Minimum of 2+ years' experience in social media, either in-house or at an agency.
* In-depth knowledge of LinkedIn, X, Instagram, and YouTube.
* Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
* Knowledge of financial services communications regulatory requirements, domestic and international.
* Confidence to pitch fresh ideas, think creatively, and identify and solve problems.
* Strong organizational skills and ability to manage several tasks simultaneously.
* Strong creative, with a strong attention to detail
* Attend or initiate kick-off meetings and the ability to manage projects independently.
* Flexibility to shift priorities and manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.
* Experience with social publishing tools (such as Sprinklr.)
* Proficiency with MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint.)


Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills* Adobe creative suite experience preferred.
* Financial Services experiences preferred.
* Employee advocacy tool experience (like Hearsay or LiveSocial)

  

Responsibilities* This individual will collaborate with colleagues across our businesses, as well as subject matter experts, to plan and execute content and assist with campaigns designed to modernize brand perception and drive profitable growth.
* The position sits within the Global Brand Experience team and reports to the Director of Social Media.
* Your primary focus will be on content creation (visual and written), publishing content, and monitoring performance, with an emphasis on content.
* Utilize social media publishing tools to coordinate and schedule content.
* Craft engaging written and visual content aligned with the firm's messaging.
* Identify and advocate for social media best practices; stay current on new technologies and industry trends and drive the adoption of innovative strategies and solutions.
* Adhere to internal and external approval processes, compliance, audit and regulatory processes and documentation.
* Monitor and analyze the performance of content and provide recommendations for content optimization based on performance data.
* Assist in the development and execution of training sessions to educate employees on LinkedIn best practices and the firm's employee social media policy.
