title: Genesis Dealership Pre-Owned Manager
description:
**Job Title:** Genesis Dealership Pre-Owned Manager


**Department:** Pre-Owned Sales Department


**Job Family:** Variable Operations


**Reports to:** General Manager


**ABOUT US**


Benzel-Busch Motor Car Corp is a reputable and authorized dealership dedicated to delivering our valued customers the highest standards of service and quality. With a rich heritage in the automotive industry, we are proud to announce our expansion as we integrate the Genesis franchise into our esteemed family that already includes Mercedes-Benz and Audi. Our journey began with a commitment to delivering the pinnacle of automotive excellence. Over the years, we have earned a reputation for offering exceptional vehicles that embody sophistication, performance, and innovation. With Mercedes-Benz and Audi, we have set the industry's standard for luxury and engineering. With the addition of the Genesis franchise, we are ushering in a new era of automotive innovation. Genesis represents the perfect fusion of modern luxury and cutting-edge technology. We are excited to offer our customers the opportunity to experience the future of mobility with a brand that redefines what it means to drive in style and comfort.


**JOB OVERVIEW**


The Pre-Owned Manager at an automotive dealership, including Genesis dealerships, is responsible for overseeing the sales and operations of pre-owned or used vehicles. This role involves managing inventory, pricing strategies, sales processes, and a team of sales consultants to maximize profitability and customer satisfaction in the pre-owned vehicle department. The Pre-Owned Manager plays a crucial role in achieving sales targets and maintaining high standards of quality and service.


**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**

* **Inventory Management:** Supervise acquiring, inspecting, and maintaining pre-owned vehicles. Ensure that the inventory is diverse, well-maintained, and priced competitively.


* **Pricing Strategy:** Develop and implement pricing strategies for pre-owned vehicles, considering market conditions, vehicle conditions, and historical sales data.


* **Sales Team Leadership:** Lead and manage a team of pre-owned sales consultants, providing coaching, training, and guidance to maximize their sales potential.


* **Sales Process Oversight:** Oversee the pre-owned vehicle sales process, ensuring sales consultants follow established best practices and maintain high ethical standards.


* **Customer Experience:** Ensure that all customer interactions in the pre-owned vehicle department provide a positive and memorable experience. Address customer inquiries, concerns, and escalations promptly and professionally.


* **Performance Metrics:** Set and monitor performance metrics and targets for the pre-owned vehicle department, including sales goals, gross profit margins, and customer satisfaction ratings.


* **Inventory Analysis:** Regularly analyze inventory turnover rates, aging, and market trends to make informed decisions regarding vehicle acquisitions, pricing adjustments, and marketing strategies.


* **Marketing and Promotions:** Collaborate with the dealership's marketing team to create and execute marketing campaigns and promotions to drive traffic to the pre-owned vehicle department.


* **Documentation:** Ensure all sales documentation and contracts for pre-owned vehicle transactions are complete, accurate, and compliant with legal and regulatory requirements.


* **Vendor Relationships:** Build and maintain relationships with vehicle wholesalers, auction houses, and other suppliers to source high-quality pre-owned vehicles.


* **Budget Management:** Manage the pre-owned vehicle department's budget effectively, controlling expenses and maximizing profitability.


* **Sales Meetings:** Conduct regular pre-owned vehicle department meetings to communicate objectives, share best practices, and address challenges.



**QUALIFICATIONS**


* **Automotive Sales Experience:** Extensive experience in automotive sales, with a strong understanding of the sales process, including prospecting, negotiation, and closing deals.


* **Pre-Owned Vehicle Knowledge:** In-depth knowledge of pre-owned vehicles, market values, and condition assessment. Familiarity with the Genesis pre-owned vehicle lineup is advantageous.


* **Leadership Skills:** Proven leadership and team-building skills, with the ability to motivate and develop sales staff.


* **Customer Focus:** A commitment to delivering exceptional customer service and a customer-centric approach.


* **Communication Skills:** Excellent verbal and written communication skills for effective team communication, customer interactions, and reporting.


* **Sales Strategy:** Ability to develop and implement successful sales and pricing strategies, adapt to market changes, and make data-driven decisions.


* **Budget Management:** Proficiency in budget management and financial analysis related to pre-owned vehicle operations.


* **Ethical Conduct:** Uphold high ethical standards and integrity in all sales activities.


* **Computer Skills:** Proficiency in using CRM software, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook), and other sales and reporting tools.


* **Market Knowledge:** Stay informed about the local automotive market, competitors, and industry trends.


* **Professionalism:** Maintain a professional appearance and demeanor when dealing with customers, colleagues, and dealership stakeholders.



**ADDITIONAL INFORMATION**


No Sponsorship / Visa Transfer is available


Must be capable of dissecting complex problems and breaking them into simplified, digestible pieces


Must be able to work flexible hours/work schedule


Work Holidays when required; Work weekends when required


**EEO Statement**


Benzel-Busch is committed to fostering an inclusive environment that appreciates and leverages the diversity of our team. We provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, ethnicity, gender, age, national origin, religion, marital status, veteran status, physical or other disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Food Quality Control Manager
description:
**Job Title:** Food Quality Control (QC) Manager  
**Location:** Newark, NJ

**Position Overview:**  
We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Food Quality Control (QC) Manager for our Newark, NJ location. The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring that all food products meet established quality standards, regulatory compliance, and customer expectations. This role involves managing the entire quality control process, developing quality assurance programs, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to continuously improve food safety and product quality.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Oversee the daily operations of the quality control department, ensuring food products meet safety and quality standards.
* Implement and maintain food safety programs, including HACCP, GMP, and other regulatory requirements.
* Develop, review, and update quality assurance procedures and protocols.
* Manage and supervise QC staff, including training, scheduling, and performance evaluations.
* Conduct regular audits and inspections of production processes and facilities to ensure compliance with food safety regulations and company standards.
* Collaborate with production, purchasing, and R&D teams to address quality issues and ensure the smooth integration of new products.
* Monitor and analyze quality control data to identify trends and areas for improvement.
* Manage customer complaints and work with relevant departments to investigate and resolve quality issues.
* Ensure compliance with all relevant federal, state, and local food safety regulations, including FDA, USDA, and FSMA standards.
* Maintain accurate documentation of quality control processes and results.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Food Science, Microbiology, or a related field.
* 5+ years of experience in food quality control or quality assurance, with at least 2 years in a management role.
* Strong knowledge of food safety regulations, including HACCP, GMP, and FSMA.
* Excellent leadership and team management skills.
* Proficient in data analysis, problem-solving, and process improvement.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple tasks effectively.
* Experience with audit processes, regulatory compliance, and corrective actions.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Certification in HACCP, SQF, or other food safety programs.
* Experience in a food manufacturing environment.
* Bilingual (English/Spanish) is a plus.

**Working Conditions:**

* The position requires work in a production environment, which may involve exposure to temperature fluctuations, noise, and food processing equipment.
* Some travel may be required to other facilities or supplier sites.

**Compensation:**  
Competitive salary with benefits package, including health insurance, retirement plans, and paid time off.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $65,325.00 - $70,834.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Experience:

* GMP: 1 year (Required)
* Management: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: On the road

title: Regional Director of Revenue Management
description:
**Join Our House**
------------------



Mint House offers tailored residential hospitality; Apartment-style hotel, combing the comforts of home with the convenience of a hotel.



Designed for today's modern traveler, our apartment-style, tech-enabled spaces are committed to bleisure travelers. Each Mint House property is thoughtfully crafted to reflect a modern aesthetic and sustainable practices, capturing unique charm of each city. Located in vibrant major downtown hubs including New York, Miami, Nashville, Philadelphia, and Dallas, Mint House offers all the essentials for routine living on the road.



Founded in 2017, Mint House has raised approximately $85M from leading venture capital firms including Mohari Hospitality and Revolution Ventures. Discover more about our innovative approach to hospitality at minthouse.com and follow @staymint on Instagram.

  



**THE ROLE**
------------



We're hiring a Regional Director of Revenue Management to lead revenue strategies across multiple properties, driving long-term success at Mint House. In this role, you will collaborate with our Chief Commercial Officer (CCO) and on-site leadership to optimize room rates and availability strategies across various distribution channels, including OTAs, Airbnb, and GDS. Your analytical expertise will be crucial in developing models, generating insights, and conducting comprehensive analyses to guide strategic decisions.


**AT MINT HOUSE YOU WILL**
--------------------------


* Analyze and monitor pricing and revenue data across multiple markets to maximize room revenue, profit, and market share.
* Utilize tools like Stayntouch and Travel Click to manage property performance and optimize property's NOI.
* Prepare and present revenue-related updates and strategies during ownership meetings.
* Collaborate with the sales team to set rates and packages for long stays, group bookings, and negotiated rates.
* Ensure competitive pricing strategies to maximize occupancy and revenue.
* Create and manage rate plans, ensuring accurate distribution across all channels.
* Provide weekly and monthly STR reports to support forecasting and pricing decisions.
* Work with Operations to oversee room status and maintenance for same-day reservations.
* Conduct competitive analysis, price positioning, and market mix reporting, while participating in ad-hoc reporting efforts.
* Optimize mix to capture hotel and vacation rental demand
* Use problem-solving skills to identify and address challenges in revenue management.
* Foster a culture of innovation by exploring new pricing strategies and approaches.

**WE ARE LOOKING FOR**
----------------------


* 4-6 years of experience in hotel or travel-related revenue management; multi-property or vacation rental experience is a plus.
* Proven ability to analyze data and present insights to influence pricing and revenue strategies.
* Proficiency in Excel and familiarity with online booking channels and pricing tools.
* Experience with RMS and iHotelier is highly advantageous.
* Curious, creative thinker with strong problem-solving skills.
* Proactive, decisive, and self-directed with excellent organizational skills.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to deliver impactful presentations.
* An excellent colleague and partner. Someone who will get things done while adding to the friendly, productive, focused culture of Mint House.
* Comfort with ambiguity and rapid pace of improvement that's a natural part of an evolving team.
* Energy and dedication. Mint House is transforming the traditional hotel model and defining a new category of residential hospitality. The Mint House team believes deeply in this mission and invests the time, energy and effort needed to make it a reality.


**Compensation Range: $90,000 - $120,000 based on experience & location**


Mint Houses' compensation philosophy is driven by our company value of fostering inclusivity. To best ensure pay equity, we typically bring in fresh mints near the middle of our listed compensation bands and lead with the best overall compensation package (i.e. all people hired at the same experience & level are brought in at the same salary, equity, and benefits). Our Talent team will work with you and can provide more details on our philosophy.



Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. If you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.



Mint House is an Equal Opportunity Employer and a workplace of belongingness. We're committed to diversity and maintaining a work environment that is free from harassment and discrimination. Applicants from all backgrounds are encouraged to apply, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of any protected status under federal, state, or local law.



New York City is where we call home, and you'll find HQs near Grand Central at 450 Lexington Ave, right within a WeWork space. No matter where our team members are located, we work on East Coast hours to foster collaboration, communication, and enjoy some lively emoji exchanges. At Mint House, we pause amidst the hustle to celebrate our wins, celebrating personal and company achievements via Slack. Embracing individuality, we honor each person and property, encouraging authenticity.



 Mint House participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.



Right To Work



E-Verify (English / Spanish)



 At Mint House, we are committed to promoting work-life integration in the most natural and enjoyable way possible. That's why we're excited to offer our team members complimentary nights at any Mint House location of their choice, plus exclusive year-round discounts. It's our way of ensuring that our employees can experience firsthand the comfort and convenience we champion. Enjoy your stay on us and see just how we blend work, life, and play at Mint House!

title: Growth Marketing Manager
description:
**Who we are:**



K Health is venture-backed, fast-growing startup with a mission to use the power of Artificial Intelligence (AI) to get everyone access to higher quality healthcare at more affordable costs. We're looking for mission driven individuals to join our team and help us eliminate healthcare inequalities to build a better and healthier future.



Featured most recently in Forbes and Business Insider as a leading AI startup, K Health is a telehealth company that harnesses the power of technology to help provide the smartest digital healthcare platform to patients, hospital systems, and providers across the United States. Our AI powered application helps bring together the knowledge of thousands of doctors and anonymous medical data to provide the highest quality care to our patients. We offer a free symptom checker, 24/7 access to board-certified doctors, ability to refill prescriptions from your phone, and more. All within one application - no insurance or preauthorization required.



K Health was founded in 2016, and has partnered with visionary and leading hospital systems and providers such as Cedars-Sinai, Mayo Clinic, and Elevance Health. Join us on our mission to help provide better healthcare for less.

**About the role:**



We are looking for an analytical and results-driven Growth Marketer to join our dynamic Marketing team in **NYC**. You will own executing and optimizing across existing channels while also identifying opportunities to expand into new channels. The ideal candidate will have a strong track record hitting business goals through constant testing.


**What you'll be doing:**


* Own strategy and execution on key marketing channels, including SEM and Paid Social (Facebook and TikTok)
* Lead all aspects of creative and landing page ideation and iteration to continually improve performance
* Partner closely with data analytics team to measure marketing effectiveness and find opportunities to improve efficiency and/or scale
* Analyze campaigns results in order to optimize campaigns to determine how and where budget should be deployed
* Communicate key marketing initiatives and results to broader team and key external partners


**What we're looking for:**


* 4+ years of experience in growth or performance marketing in fast-paced environments with hands-on SEM and/or Paid Social experience preferred
* Demonstrated ability to hit business growth goals through creative and landing page optimizations and channel expansion
* Data and results-driven with strong ability to tell a story using data insights and performance results
* Excellent problem-solving skills with track record of using data-driven approaches to solve complex business problems
* Strong communication skills and experience working cross-functionally with internal creative, data, and product teams and external partners
* Desire to stay abreast of current marketing trends and best practices
* Highly motivated, detail-oriented, and a team player
* **This role will be in office in NYC**


**Benefits & Perks:** #LI-Hybrid


* Weekly lunches and stocked fridges
* Monthly social committees for company events
* 18 vacation days, 9 company holidays, 5 sick days, and 2 personal days
* Stock options for every full-time employee
* Paid parental leave
* 401k benefit
* Commuter Benefits
* Competitive health, dental, and vision insurance options


We offer competitive compensation packages based on industry benchmarks for function, level, and geographic location. Offer amounts are determined by multiple factors such as a candidate's experience and expertise.



We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and consider applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, citizenship, military or veteran status, or any other class protected by applicable federal, state, and local laws. We're deeply committed to building teams as diverse as the patients we serve and strive to cultivate an environment where everyone can bring their most authentic self to work. We depend on our differences to make our team stronger, our workplace more dynamic, and our product accessible to all of our users.



We are committed to maintaining the integrity of our hiring process and ensuring a safe environment for all candidates. All communication for job offers from K Health will come from email addresses ending in @khealth.com. K Health will never ask you to provide financial information about yourself during the recruitment process. We will never use personal email accounts or other domains for official correspondence. Our official job postings are only listed on our official website and reputable job boards. Be cautious of job offers from sources other than these platforms.

title: Operations Lead - Columbus Circle
description:
**WHY JOIN ALO?**



Mindful movement. It's at the core of why we do what we do at Alo—it's our calling. Because mindful movement in the studio leads to better living. It changes who yogis are off the mat, making their lives and their communities better. That's the real meaning of studio-to-street: taking the consciousness from practice on the mat and putting it into practice in life.

**OVERVIEW**



The Operations Lead is critical in the store leadership team and is responsible for driving and coaching to profitability and efficiency. The Operations Lead will work closely with the Operations & Visual Manager in initiating, delegating work, and providing feedback to the team to achieve optimal results supporting total store operations.



Operations Leader


* Lead & execute inventory management processes effectively with a focus om maximizing inventory accuracy and reducing shrink
* Investigate and root cause inventory accuracy issues, partnering with the General Manager to escalate process or system gaps
* Manage execution of key operational functions including shipment, receiving and processing, reverse transfers, sales floor recovery, intra-day sales floor replenishment, floor set updates, and supply management
* Champion strong visual standards for the sales floor
* Support a safe work environment and efficient operation through strong stockroom standards and processes


Business Leader


* Partner with Operations & Visual Manager to manage reporting, budgets, expenses, inventory control, supplies, vendor relationships, technology, and facilities to ensure maintained and maximized
* Demonstrate strong business acumen by leveraging metrics to support business-driving strategies
* Move dynamically on the retail floor to assess and fulfill the needs of the business, team and guests


People Leader


* Leads by example and inspires staff in daily operations and guest experience.
* Directly oversee the Operations Associates; responsible for recruitment and development of talent
* Use company performance tools to evaluate each operations associate and provide constant feedback to drive individual growth and improvement in partnership with the store leader


Business Partner


* Collaborate with Visual Lead to ensure cross-functional training, and Sales & Service Lead to ensure the business is well-executed
* Execute company-level operations-focused directives, projects and initiates, in partnership with the Operations & Visual Manager (e.g. from the SCC)


Operations Lead Qualifications:


* 2+ Years prior work experience in a client-centric, sales environment
* Proven leadership capabilities demonstrating excellent decision making
* Values feedback, receptive to receiving feedback and eager to provide
* High energy, upbeat and enthusiastic with the ability to integrate fun and work
* Self-motivated with a desire to achieve results and excel individually, and as a team
* Excellent interpersonal and written communication skills
* Aligns with and embodies Alo's guiding principles
* Job Level: Associate


The Lead role is full-time and requires 32 - 40 hours per week fulfilling the job description as stated above. To build a balanced schedule that supports the needs of the business and our teams, we expect all full-time employees to have open availability and are expected to work variable shifts including peak days and weekends. All employees without exception are expected to be able to work during the company's Blackout period, from the week of American Thanksgiving (including Black Friday and Thanksgiving weekend) through the end of the holiday season (the 1st week of January).


**JUST SOME OF THE PERKS**

  

* Generous employee discount for Bella+Canvas, Alo Yoga, and free membership to Alo Moves, with access to hundreds of streaming fitness and yoga classes with top instructors
* Competitive medical, dental and vision plan options, and enhanced additional benefits such as free virtual access to mental health providers and new parent support for employees and dependents (Full-Time Employees)
* 401K with company matching (Full-Time Employees)
* Monthly Store Incentives
* Clothing Allowance
* Free yoga classes at any of our Sanctuaries


The Company's Lead base pay ranges from $20.00 - $24.00/ hour in New York, NY. Please also note, Leads are eligible to participate in the Company's Monthly Store Incentive bonus program, which may result in bringing the total compensation to a higher range. Further, the range listed is just one component of the Company's total rewards package for retail employees. Other rewards may include: clothing allowance, employee discount, 401K, competitive medical, dental, and vision plans, commuter benefits, Talkspace, and AloMoves.



#LI-JJ1



#LI-3



#li-onsite



Please review our company California Job Applicant Privacy Policy HERE.

title: Temporary On-Site Promoter - EV Charging
description:
**About Revel**



Revel's mission is to accelerate EV adoption in cities by providing the infrastructure and services that make it easy to go electric. Revel operates the nation's first all-electric rideshare service, which delivers thousands of rides across New York City every day. Revel is also the leading public fast charging provider in New York, with stations in Manhattan, Brooklyn and Queens, and more on the way. Founded in Brooklyn in 2018, Revel first began as a shared electric moped platform and has since grown to be a top partner for big cities pursuing an electric vehicle future — first in New York, with other markets to come soon.


**Our Operating Principles**



Revel's Operating Principles represent who we are, how we act, and what we believe. They define our culture.


**Empathy.** We seek to understand the experiences and perspectives of each other, our customers and the communities where we operate.


**Ownership.** We are excited by big challenges and care deeply about our work. We empower and rely on each other and hold ourselves to a high standard.


**Humility.** We take our work seriously but not ourselves. We're approachable, curious, and know we have a lot to learn.


**Adaptability.** We expect change and quickly adjust our approach to reflect new information. We know success requires seeing opportunity in obstacles and relentlessly improving.


**Simplicity.** We clarify and prioritize what can be done now. We strive to keep things no more complicated than absolutely required.

**Dates of Assignment:** September 24th – October 13th, 2024


**Position Overview:** Revel is seeking two temporary on-site promoters to engage with electric vehicle (EV) charging customers at our EV charging locations. This role is ideal for individuals who are proactive, customer-oriented, and able to promote our charging services effectively.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Actively interact with customers at our EV charging stations, promoting our services and assisting them with signing up for our charging app.
* Distribute marketing materials, such as flyers, to customers on-site.
* Respond to basic inquiries about our EV charging services and app features.
* Promote our " discounted charging" offer to customers.


**Requirements:**


* Previous experience in customer service or engagement is required.
* Must be available to work on-site at EV charging locations (parking garages and lots).
* Strong communication skills with the ability to engage customers confidently.
* Fluency in English; fluency in Spanish or Bengali is a plus.


**Compensation:**



This is a non-exempt position offering $20-25/hr depending on experience. This role is eligible for overtime pay in excess of 40 hours per week.


**Schedule:**



This role will be scheduled during the hours of 4PM to 1AM, Tuesday through Saturday. Start and end times may vary depending on need.

  



Revel is an equal opportunity employer. All facets of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or release, will be based on merit, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.



https://www.cigna.com/legal/compliance/machine-readable-files. *This link leads to the machine readable files that are made available in response to the federal Transparency in Coverage Rule and includes negotiated service rates and out-of-network allowed amounts between health plans and healthcare providers. The machine-readable files are formatted to allow researchers, regulators, and application developers to more easily access and analyze data.*

title: Middle Market Underwriting Summer Intern
description:
With a company culture rooted in collaboration, expertise and innovation, we aim to promote progress and inspire our clients, employees, investors and communities to achieve their greatest potential. Our work is the catalyst that helps others achieve their goals. In short, We Enable Possibility℠.
About This Internship
Arch’s 10-week summer internship program offers students a unique opportunity to gain hands on experience in the insurance industry. It provides challenging learning experiences that serve as a foundation for interns to explore their career choices and to develop professional skills. Working alongside some of the most talented members of the specialty insurance industry, interns will gain relevant expertise in various aspects of the field, participate in learning activities and receive ongoing feedback.
About This Role* Gain exposure to Middle Market, Excess & Umbrella, and Programs business segments across all property & casualty product lines.
* Participate in job shadowing and assignment-based projects.
* Collaborate with Underwriters and the Chief Underwriting Officer on broker-facing tasks, risk evaluation, portfolio management, and regulatory/compliance matters.
* Contribute to a group project addressing a current industry issue.


Qualifications* Actively completing area of study in Insurance & Risk Management, Finance, Business Administration, or related program.
* Minimum 3.0 GPA or higher.
* College level – current Junior or Senior.
* Interest and experience in insurance industry preferred.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Leadership experience, including a combination of work, student organization, sports, and/or volunteer, preferred.
* Entrepreneurial spirit along with the desire to be a continuous learner.
* Team player who collaborates effectively.
* Self-starter who can work independently and deal effectively with multiple tasks/priorities in a fast-paced environment.


Location & Work Arrangement* The program dates are June 2 - August 8, 2025.
* This position is classified as a hybrid position. You will work 2 days onsite and 3 days from home.
* This position is in New York City, NY.
* Relocation and housing assistance is not provided for this role.


Timeline
Arch summer internship positions will be posted from Sept 2024 and will be unposted when filled.
Pay
For individuals assigned to or hired to work in New York City, NY, the hourly rate is $22-30 as of the time of posting. The breadth in the range exists to accommodate students in specialized programs such as actuarial candidates and graduate students. Any actual rate offered will take into account a number of factors including but not limited to geographic location, scope & responsibilities of the role, along with the education & qualifications of the candidate. The above range may be modified in the future. Intern position is eligible for select Arch benefits.

title: Direct Support Professional
description:
\\*Job Overview\\*

We are seeking dedicated individuals to join our team as Direct Support Professionals. As a Direct Support Professional, you will play a vital role in providing care and support to individuals in need within a group home or nursing home setting.

\\*Responsibilities\\*

- Provide patient observation and ensure the safety and well-being of residents

- Support individuals with Emotional care .

- Uphold resident rights and promote a safe and nurturing environment

- Engage residents in meaningful activities and social interactions

title: Dental Assistant (Oral Surgery)
description:
### **At Leading Edge Oral Surgery, we are committed to providing an exceptional level of care to our patients. Our employees are ambitious, driven and have fun while delivering high quality care in beautiful, modern offices complete with state-of-the-art technology. We're looking for dedicated team members to help build our network of practices and provide excellent experiences to all our patients.**


**Please Note:** Prior dental assisting experience is required for this particular role and must be available to travel between our Huntington and Centereach locations, details below!


### **OUR PRACTICE:**


**Leading Edge Oral Surgery (****Huntington) -** 790 New York Ave Suite 100, Huntington, NY 11743
**Leading Edge Oral Surgery (Centereach) -** 1 Mark Tree Rd, Centereach, NY 11720
### **HIRING SCHEDULE:**


* **Sunday:** OFF
* **Monday**: 8:45am-5:00pm (Centereach)
* **Tuesday**: 8:45am-5:00pm (Huntington)
* **Wednesday**: OFF
* **Thursday**: 8:45am-5:00pm (Centereach)
* **Friday**: 8:45am-5:00pm (Huntington)
* **x1 per month Saturday**: 8:45am-1:00pm (Huntington)

### **RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Welcoming patients with a smile, making them feel comfortable and confident throughout their visit.
* Support the Oral Surgeon with various procedures.
* Taking digital radiographs, CBCT and intra-oral scans as prescribed
* Ensure strict infection control by meticulously preparing and sterilizing instruments and equipment.
* Sanitizing and prepping operatories for respective treatments.
* Adhere to OSHA and safety policies, prioritizing a secure and healthy environment.
* Educate patients on effective oral hygiene strategies as needed
* Undertake diverse office tasks as needed for seamless practice operations.

### **QUALIFICATIONS:**


* **Prior dental assisting experience required.**
* Any certification/license as required by the state to perform specified duties.
* A resume showcasing a consistent and stable employment history.
* Strong interpersonal communication skills, delivering exceptional patient experiences.

### **OUR BENEFITS:**


* **Generous Compensation:** We invest in the best and are competitive in our salary offers.
* **Flexible Health and Vision Insurance Plans**: Tailored options for you and your family's well-being.
* **401(K) Retirement Plan with Matching:** Secure your financial future with our employer-matched plan up to 6%.
* **Generous Paid-Time Off:** Accrue up to 3 weeks, plus an annual "you" day for self-care.
* **Exclusive In-house Dental Program**: Heavily discounted services for you and your immediate family.
* **Fresh Scrubs:** Accrue an annual scrub allowance through our uniform partners.
* **Extra Perks and Fringe Benefits:** Enjoy additional benefits and ongoing perks for our dedicated teams.


* *All benefits available at full-time employment (30+ hours weekly). Some benefits available for part-time employees as well.*



New York Salary Range: $19/HR - $24/HR


### **Step into a new era with Leading Edge Specialized Dentistry**


**A modern practice environment designed for superior care and comfort.** We embrace cutting-edge technology in a soothing environment that goes beyond your ordinary dental practice. We've thought through every step in the patient's experience to perfect our communication and care so that each visit is an eagerly anticipated event.


**We're a team that supports your success.** Emphasizing health over sales, we cultivate a warm, supportive culture without the pressure of production quotas. Those motivated for growth in their career are encouraged and supported to reach their full potential.


**We celebrate diversity.** Our company provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression in terms of all conditions of employment. Our diversity is one of our greatest strengths, and as an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to promote a work environment where all differences are respected.

title: Research Scientist-Biophysics and Skin Imaging
description:
No Relocation Assistance Offered  

# 162765 - Piscataway, New Jersey, United States  

  

**Who We Are**  

Colgate-Palmolive Company is a caring, innovative growth company that is reimagining a healthier future for all people, their pets and our planet. Focused on Oral Care, Personal Care, Home Care and Pet Nutrition, we sell our products in more than 200 countries and territories under brands such as Colgate, Palmolive, elmex, hello, meridol, Sorriso, Tom’s of Maine, EltaMD, Filorga, Irish Spring, PCA SKIN, Protex, Sanex, Softsoap, Speed Stick, Ajax, Axion, Fabuloso, Soupline and Suavitel, as well as Hill’s Pet Nutrition.  

  

We are recognized for our leadership and innovation in promoting sustainability and community wellbeing, including our achievements in decreasing plastic waste and promoting recyclability, saving water, conserving natural resources and improving children’s oral health.  

  

If you want to work for a company that lives by their values, then give your career a reason to smile and join our global team!

 **Colgate-Palmolive is seeking a highly motivated and proactive professional with a track record of excellence in skin biophysics (measurements and imaging) and innovation experience with premium/professional skin care products for a Research Scientist / Senior Research Scientist position in Research & Innovation Personal Care group, Global R&D. This on-site position is based at our Piscataway, NJ location.**

 **The core responsibilities of this role are as follows:**

* **Identify and develop new technologies to drive innovation and address unmet consumer needs**
* **Identify new forms or modes that improve skin health and skin treatment experience and develop them into product prototypes**
* **Develop test methods and demos with bioinstruments to illustrate mechanism of action and provide scientific support on products performance**
* **Communicate with technical and business partners to provide updates and address key concerns**
* **Identify and lead collaboration effort with external partners/suppliers**
* **Collaborate with cross-functional teams to achieve project goals**

**Required Qualifications:**

* **Advanced degree in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Chemical Engineering or Biology, Ph.D. preferred.**
* **1 or more years of research experience in biophysical analysis and spectroscopic microscopy imaging of skin**

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* **Strong skills in problem solving, project management and execution, communication (written/verbal) and collaboration**
* **Experienced with optical imaging technologies like RCM and MPT**
* **Experienced with skin clinical study and clinical innovation**
* **Knowledge of in-vitro and ex-vivo skin test models**
* **Knowledge of beauty device development**
* **Knowledge of computational biology**

 **Compensation and Benefits**  

Salary Range $100,000.00 - $120,000.00 USD  

  

Pay is based on multiple non-discriminatory, individualized factors including but not limited to experience, job-related knowledge and education, skills and office/market location. In addition to base salary, salaried employees are eligible for annual discretionary bonuses, profit-sharing and, for Executive-level (salary grade 16 and above) roles only, long-term incentives in the form of Restricted Stock Units and/or Stock Options.  

  

Subject to the terms and conditions of the applicable benefits plans then in effect, all salaried employees are also eligible for a competitive benefits package which includes:

* Insurance: Employees (and their eligible dependents) are eligible to participate in Company-sponsored Medical, Dental, Vision, Basic Life Insurance, Accidental Death & Dismemberment and Disability insurance plans.
* Retirement Plans: Employees are eligible to enroll in Colgate's 401(k) plan, which provides for company matching contributions subject to eligibility requirements
* Vacation/PTO: Employees receive a minimum of 15 days of vacation/PTO leave annually
* Paid Holidays: Employees receive a minimum of 13 paid/floating holidays annually
* Paid Sick Leave: Based on location and consistent with applicable state and local law, employees receive a minimum of 40 hours of paid sick leave on January 1st of each year
* Paid Parental Leave: Eligible employees may take up to eight weeks of paid parental leave and 12 weeks of unpaid leave (varies for employees with fewer than 12 months of service and is subject to hours worked requirements)

 **Our Commitment to Sustainability**  

With the Colgate brand in more homes than any other, we are presented with great opportunities and new challenges as we work to integrate sustainability into all aspects of our business and create positive social impact. We are determined to position ourselves for further growth as we act on our 2025 Sustainability & Social Impact Strategy.  

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**  

Achieving our purpose starts with our people — ensuring our workforce represents the people and communities we serve —and creating an environment where our people feel they belong; where we can be our authentic selves, feel treated with respect and have the support of leadership to impact the business in a meaningful way.  

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**  

Colgate is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, marital status, veteran status (United States positions), or any other characteristic protected by law.  

  

Reasonable accommodation during the application process is available for persons with disabilities. Please contact Application\\_Accommodation@colpal.com with the subject "Accommodation Request" should you require accommodation.  

  

For additional Colgate terms and conditions, please click here.

title: ABS Consumer - Associate Director
description:
**Position Title: ABS Consumer - Associate Director**


**Entity: Kroll Bond Rating Agency, LLC**


**Employment Type: Full-Time**


**Location: New York, New York, United States**

  


**Summary****:**


**KBRA** (Kroll Bond Rating Agency) is seeking an experienced **consumer asset-backed securities (ABS)** **credit analyst** to specialize in sectors such as auto loan, auto lease, consumer loan, home improvement loan, credit card, solar loan and other consumer assets. This position is based in our **New Yor**k office.

  


**Key Job Requirements****:**


* Perform transaction analysis including originator/servicer evaluation, collateral performance analysis, pool analysis, formulation of cash flow assumptions evaluation of transaction cash flows, and review of legal structure and documentation.
* Facilitate the preparation of credit memoranda and presentation of transactions to rating committees.
* Serve as lead analyst and primary contact to clients, structuring banks and investors on transactions.
* Lead the development and publication of individual transactions reports, surveillance reports, special topic and market commentaries and rating methodologies.
* Serve as industry expert for one or more asset classes.
* Surveil and monitor rated transactions, updating ratings on existing transactions.
* Write articles for publication on individual transactions as well as special topic and market commentaries.
* Attend industry conference, which may include preparing and presenting research and providing sector updates.
* Mentor and foster the development of junior analysts.
* Willingness to travel as needed.

  


**Key Skills/Experience****:**


* Six (6) to Eight (8) or more years of demonstrated success in performing credit analysis on ABS transactions at a rating agency, buy-side, credit research, banking or other similar firm.
* Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills are essential.
* Advanced **Excel**, and **Intex** skills are a plus.
* Ability to take initiative and work independently, as well as work closely with partners in a collaborative environment.

  





**Salary Range:**



The anticipated annual base salary range for this full-time position is $120,000 to $170,000. Offer amounts are determined by factors such as experience, skills, geography, and other job-related factors.

  


**Benefits:**


* A hybrid work schedule (Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays in the office.)
* Competitive benefits and paid time off
* Paid family and disability leave
* 401(k) plan, including employer match (100% vested)
* Educational and professional development financial assistance
* Employee referral bonus program

  


**About Us:**



Kroll Bond Rating Agency, LLC (KBRA) is a full-service credit rating agency registered with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission as an NRSRO. Kroll Bond Rating Agency Europe Limited is registered as a CRA with the European Securities and Markets Authority. Kroll Bond Rating Agency UK Limited is registered as a CRA with the UK Financial Conduct Authority pursuant to the Temporary Registration Regime. In addition, KBRA is designated as a designated rating organization by the Ontario Securities Commission for issuers of asset-backed securities to file a short form prospectus or shelf prospectus. KBRA is also recognized by the National Association of Insurance Commissioners as a Credit Rating Provider.

  


**More Info:**



KBRA encourages applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, marital status, citizenship, disability, and veteran status or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law.

title: Field Auto Adjuster - Philadelphia, PA
description:
At Allstate, great things happen when our people work together to protect families and their belongings from life’s uncertainties. And for more than 90 years our innovative drive has kept us a step ahead of our customers’ evolving needs. From advocating for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws, to being an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, and, more recently, device and identity protection.

**Job Description**


As a Field Auto Adjuster, you will play a crucial role in our Auto claims handling process by writing estimates directly at customer homes, repair shops, or tow yards. Your job will involve a variety of customer/shop interactions, including face-to-face, virtual, and written communication, as you assess and finalize estimates. With a diverse range of workstreams, including repairable estimates, total loss assessments, and virtual inspections, you will enjoy a dynamic and engaging work environment. You must live in Philadelphia/Camden, PA /NJ area to be eligible for this role.**A day in the life of the Field Auto Damage Adjuster, and what it takes to do the job!**

**The Customer Service Expert** – you’ll live into Allstate’s Claims Culture by caring, empowering, and restoring, and you will accomplish that by being compassionate, clear, and a committed partner in each Casualty claim. You lead with empathy, always.

 **The Investigator** – you’ll confidently and independently investigate casualty (and applicable LOB (line of business)) claims by performing detailed reviews of damage and interpreting policies to determine coverage.

 **The Effective Communicator** – you’ll use phone, emails and sometimes even video chat with customers to help them through a fast, fair, and easy claims process. You’ll also incorporate a specific approach to claim handling to offer the customer their preference of communication to efficiently discuss their claim needs and keep them updated on the claim progress.

 **The Negotiator** – You will evaluate and negotiate claims settlements with customers, vendors, third party carriers and claimants, in accordance with all legal and business standard methodologies. With negotiations, you will incorporate tactics in handling challenging and complex situations.

 **The Problem Solver** – you’ll utilize multiple tools to get the job done in a fast-paced environment, including estimate tools, job aids, and additional settlement platforms, all while using your sharp critical thinking skills.

 **The Recorder** – you’ll protect the company financially by executing policies along policy agreements, and you keep a clear record of your work in a claims system that you will be trained on. You’ll accomplish this by ensuring timely and accurate documentation is completed as you work on each claim.

**Work Location**

* This position is a field-based role. To be eligible for this role, you must be located in the following locations: **Philadelphia, PA / Camden NJ Area**
* This position is eligible for a monthly internet stipend of $80 to offset the costs of internet expenses

**Company Car**

  

Based on our Company Car Guidelines, this role may qualify for a company car. Our leadership team determines this based on annual work mileage for this location. You may be required to use your personal vehicle until these guidelines are met. We offer mileage reimbursements for personal vehicle usage during work.”


***“Please note, you may be required to attend 1-week of training that will take place in Wheeling, IL.”***

**Preferred Qualifications**

* You have 18 months+ experience in auto Collision estimating using CCC or Mitchell.
* You have a High School Diploma or a GED
* Proficient written and verbal communication skills to effectively interact with customers.
* Strong attention to detail and ability to write precise and comprehensive estimates.
* Comfortable with utilizing technology and various platforms for claims processing.
* Excellent time management and organizational skills to manage multiple assignments effectively.
* Valid driver's license and willingness to travel as part of the job requirements.

**Notice of Licensing Requirement**

* As a condition of employment, you may be expected to obtain an adjuster’s license in multiple markets
* All required licenses will need to be obtained within 60 days of hire
* You must maintain all licensing required for your role. This includes any continuing education and/or other state-affiliated requirements for licensing renewal
* This role offers a sign on bonus of $1,000 if you have an active appraiser license or active adjuster license in TX, FL, or your resident state (current employees and candidates who have previously worked for and are seeking to be rehired at Allstate and its family of companies are not eligible for this sign-on bonus)

**Benefits**


Allstate cares about you and your wellbeing. We offer a comprehensive total rewards package that includes pay, benefits, and programs to help you balance work with the rest of your life. You can choose whatever benefits are most important you. Here are some of our offerings:

* Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications
* Medical, dental, and vision coverage
* Allstate pension plan and 401(k) savings plan
* Ayco financial coaching
* Spring Health mental and emotional wellbeing resources
* Paid parental leave
* Adoption reimbursement
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement
* Wellness incentives

**Notes**


The preceding description is not designed to be a complete list of all duties and responsibilities. May be required to perform other related duties as assigned. Regular, predictable attendance is an essential function of this job.

**This position is not available for residents of California, Alaska, and Hawaii.**

title: RN Care Delivery Field Supervisor- Full-Time- Queens, NY
description:
Our client is seeking a dedicated and experienced **RN Care Delivery Field Supervisor** to join their team. Reporting to the Clinical / Center Service Director, the RN Care Delivery Field Supervisor will oversee and ensure high-quality clinical services for patients in their homes. This role is integral to maintaining our nursing standards of excellence and delivering care that is sensitive to diverse backgrounds and needs.Make a difference in the lives of the geriatric population by ensuring they receive high-quality home health care.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Supervision & Delegation:** Collaborate with the Care Delivery Manager to supervise and delegate responsibilities to assigned personnel, ensuring quality care and adherence to care plans.
* **Assessment & Evaluation:** Assess and evaluate participants’ health care needs, considering physical, mental, and environmental factors.
* **Guidance & Instruction:** Supervise and guide Community Health Nurses (CHNs) and Home Health Aides (HHAs) in delivering quality home health care services.
* **Joint Visits & Competencies:** Conduct joint visits with CHNs for supervision and competency assessment.
* **Orientation & Training:** Assist in designing orientation programs for new employees and provide education to participants and aides on medications, safety, and diet.
* **Collaboration & Care Planning:** Work with the interdisciplinary team to develop comprehensive care plans tailored to individual participant needs.
* **Documentation & Reporting:** Maintain accurate documentation and submit reports as required by Health System standards and federal/state regulations.
* **Field Visits & Audits:** Conduct field visits in place of CHNs as needed and perform routine chart audits.
* **Travel:** Travel is required, including potential coverage of neighboring sites.
* **Regulatory Compliance:** Act as a core interdisciplinary team member, ensuring compliance with CMS PACE regulatory requirements.

**Qualifications:**

* **Education:**
* Degree from an NLN-accredited nursing school (RN, BSN required).
* Baccalaureate degree highly desired.
* At least five (5) years of experience in a healthcare setting is acceptable in lieu of BSN.
* **Experience:**
* Minimum of one (1) year of experience as a community health nurse in a Certified Home Health Agency, Long Term Home Health Care Program, or Licensed Agency.
* Experience working with geriatric populations preferred.
* Experience in a PACE Program or MLTC preferred.
* Managed long-term care insurance experience beneficial.
* **Skills:**
* Excellent organizational and presentation skills.
* Proficient with computers and laptops.
* Strong knowledge of New York State Department of Health regulations.
* **Licensure:**
* Current active and unrestricted license and registration in New York State as a Registered Nurse required.
* Valid New York State driver’s license and reliable transportation preferred.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $110,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid sick time
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Home Health

License/Certification:

* RN License (Required)

title: Laboratory Assistant - Fall Internship Opportunity!
description:
**Company Description**  

We are SGS – the world's leading testing, inspection and certification company. We are recognized as the global benchmark for sustainability, quality and integrity. Our 99,600 employees operate a network of 2,600 offices and laboratories, working together to enable a better, safer and more interconnected world.

 **Job Description**  

Our **Dayton, NJ laboratory** is excited to offer an internship opportunity to candidates who are interested in a Lab Assistant role. We are looking for candidates who can commit **20 hours a week** throughout the 2024 fall semester. **This is a paid internship opportunity!**


The Laboratory Assistant will complete a wide variety of support tasks for the Lab Technicians and Lab Analysts, ensuring best quality by following SGS’ SOPs. The Laboratory Assistant works independently and as part of a team to ensure timely completion of all assigned tasks. The Laboratory Assistant always follows safe laboratory practices and maintains a safe working environment.

**Job functions:**

* Signs out supplies from supply room.
* Maintains adequate supply of accessories, consumables, chemicals, etc. in each lab, to ensure efficiency of production work.
* Disposes of samples after the appropriate retention period.
* Documents in LIMS and disposes of expired/depleted chemicals.
* Assembles non-treated in-house media.
* Decontaminates/cleans laboratory glassware, containers, accessories, etc., following SOPs.
* Performs administrative tasks, as needed.
* Adheres to internal standards, policies, and procedures.
* Performs other duties as required.

  

**Qualifications**  

* High school diploma (Required)
* HS diploma and 1-2 years of general work experience (Preferred)
* Proficient English language skills (Required)
* Basic reasoning and mathematical skills (Required)
* Basic computer skills (Required)
* Ability to lift/carry/push and/or pull upwards of 25 lb on a frequent basis (Required)

  

**Additional Information**  

SGS is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and as such we recruit, hire, train, and promote persons in all job classifications without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetics, status as a protected veteran, or any other characteristics protected by law.


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily with or without reasonable accommodations. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required.


This job description should not be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements, but a general description of the job. Nothing contained herein restricts the company’s rights to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.


If you are applying for a position within the United States and you have difficulty completing the on-line employment application because of a disability, please call 201-508-3149 for assistance and leave a message. You will receive a call back. Please note, this phone number is not for general employment information, but is only for individuals who are experiencing difficulty applying for a position due to a disability.

description:
**RN Risk Manager**

**East Meadow, NY**

**Full-Time**

**Salary: $111,538/yr**

We are NuHealth. We want to make health care more affordable and more accessible here on Long Island. We are committed to delivering excellent essential medical care, and disease and lifestyle management to everyone, at every stage of life. We are experiencing some exciting changes, including expanding our services and developing new programs.

**If you want to be part of the only safety net hospital in Nassau County, we have amazing openings in our Risk Management Department.**

**In this role, you will:**

* Coordinate aspects of the Hospital Risk Management Program. This includes, the following areas: Development, implementation and monitoring of Risk Management projects, policies and procedures.
* Provide consultations/assistance to medical and administrative staff on legal issues/hospital policy.
* Ensure compliance with legal and regulatory requirements, including: Coordinating service of legal documents: Review of all Hospital’s incident/occurrence reports, QA referrals, and select patient complaints. NYS Department of Health/Office of Health Systems Management Patient Complaint and Article 28 (NYPORTS) process: NYS Office of Mental Health (OMH) reporting requirements: Reporting requirements of the NYS Commission of Quality of Care (CQC) for the mentally disabled.
* Collaborate with other departments to design methods to achieve optimal patient safety initiatives via review and trending of patient safety data.
* Coordinate adverse event review process including Root Cause Analysis (RCA) for defined events for the hospital site and associated Faculty Group Practice sites.
* Assist Regulatory Affairs as warranted with DOH on-site surveys, OPMC and OPD inquiries.
* Coordinate hospital and or Health System wide Failure Mode Effect Analysis (FMEA) as required
* Coordinate with other clinical and administrative departments regarding risk management issues; Available to provide direction and coordinate counsel to physician, nursing and administrative staff regarding medical-legal issues. Monitors Risk Management cases and issues. Participates in special projects and performs other related duties.
* Review electronically reported events on a daily basis; investigate events that led to real or potential patient harm.

**We require:**

* Possession of a current license to practice as a registered professional nurse in New York Statewith two years of satisfactory professional nursing experience.
* Enrollment in a baccalaureate program in Nursing, Community Health, or other health related field at a regionally accredited or New York State registered college or university.

**RN Risk Manager, for immediate consideration, please send your resume to us at careers@numc.edu.**

**We offer a competitive salary, medical, dental, life insurance, NYS Pension Plan and other excellent benefits.**

title: Remote Manager Case Management
description:
**Company Description** **WHO IS GUIDEHEALTH?**


Guidehealth is a data-powered, performance-driven healthcare company dedicated to operational excellence. Our goal is to make great healthcare affordable, improve the health of patients, and restore the fulfillment of practicing medicine for providers. Driven by empathy and powered by AI and predictive analytics, Guidehealth leverages remotely-embedded Healthguides™ and a centralized Managed Service Organization to build stronger connections with patients and providers. Physician-led, Guidehealth empowers our partners to deliver high-quality healthcare focused on outcomes and value inside and outside the exam room for all patients.

 **Job Description**  

In this position you will lead this department in meeting their complex care management goals. This role involves managing the outreach to select patients identified by Blue Cross Blue Shield. ICD 10 codes, readmissions and frequency of ER visits.This role is responsible for project management and supervision of the Case Managers. Over the course of the fiscal year, you will work to meet the Key Performance Indicators around program enrollment. The ideal candidate will be Registered Nursing Degree from an accredited school.


5+ years nursing experience in an acute care setting (Care Management experience a plus).

**What You’ll be doing**

* Departmental expectations; staff hiring, orientation, auditing, and reviews; time management; motivation; and performance improvement
* Project Management and delegation of duties to ensure coverage for all tasks
* Prioritization of data, tasks, and requirements: Delegation with expertise of departmental tasks and processes
* Representative for BCBS audits with development of actions plans for each individual IPA to ensure compliance and incentive payouts
* Oversee all projects, daily tasks and PHM activities in an organized and efficient manner
* Ensure access to EMR systems for department staff
* Monitor staff maintenance of HIPPA regulations
* Communication with IPA Administrators and Client Business Managers to ensure resolution of any concerns.
* Identification and dissemination of Health Plan announcements applicable to Population Health

  

**Qualifications** **WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO HAVE**

* At least 2 – 5+ years of related work experience.
* 3+ years of management experience
* Knowledge set including: evidenced based practices, social determinants/barriers of health, motivational interviewing, and goal setting
* Experience working with complex data sets
* Healthcare data experience

**Would Love For You Have:**

* In depth knowledge of MSA and UM/PHM Plan with ability to decipher meanings and changes
* In depth knowledge of all contracted IPAs
* Knowledge of national guidelines and care trends/incentives, crossovers with quality, and insights to analytics

  

**Additional Information**  

The base pay range for this role $95K per year paid bi-weekly per our standard payroll practices. Final base pay decisions are dependent upon a variety of factors which may include, but are not limited to: skill set, years of relevant experience, education, location, and licensure/certifications.

**BENEFITS:**


While you are hard at work advancing value-based healthcare, we are here to ensure YOU have the care you and your family need and the opportunities for growth and development. Our commitments to you include:

* Work from Home: Guidehealth is a fully remote company, providing you the flexibility to spend less time commuting and more time focusing on your professional goals and personal needs.
* Keep Health a Priority: We offer comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision plans to keep you covered.
* Plan for the Future: Our 401(k) plan includes a 3% employer match to your 6% contribution.
* Have Peace of Mind: We provide Life and Disability insurance for those "just in case" moments. Additionally, we offer voluntary Life options to keep you and your loved ones protected.
* Feel Supported When You Need It Most: Our Employee Assistance Program (EAP) is here to help you through tough times.
* Take Time for Yourself: We offer Flexible Time Off tailored to meet your needs and the needs of the business, helping you achieve work-life balance and meet your personal goals.
* Support Your New Family: Welcoming a new family member takes time and commitment. Guidehealth offers paid parental leave to give you the time you need.
* Learn and Grow: Your professional growth is important to us. Guidehealth offers various resources dedicated to your learning and development to advance your career with us.


**COMPENSATION:**


The listed compensation range listed is paid bi-weekly per our standard payroll practices. Final base pay decisions are dependent upon a variety of factors which may include, but are not limited to: skill set, years of relevant experience, education, location, and licensure/certifications.


**OUR COMMITMENT TO EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYMENT**


Diversity, inclusion, and belonging are at the core of Guidehealth’s values. We are an equal opportunity employer. We enthusiastically accept our responsibility to make employment decisions without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation and identity, national origin, citizenship, religion, marital status, familial status, physical, sensory, or medical disability, Family and Medical Leave, military or veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth or other related medical conditions, or any other classification protected by federal, state, and local laws and ordinances. Our management is fully dedicated to ensuring the fulfillment of this policy with respect to hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, demotion, layoff, termination, recruitment advertising, pay, and other forms of compensation, training, and general treatment during employment.


**OUR COMITTMENT TO PROTECTION OF PATIENT AND COMPANY DATA**


This position is responsible for following all Security policies and procedures in order to protect all PHI and PII under Guidehealth’s custodianship as well as Guidehealth Intellectual Properties. For any security-specific roles, the responsibilities would be further defined by the hiring manager.

title: Manager of Commercial Partnerships
description:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world's leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car, cruise, or vacation package. We're also transforming the in-travel experience with our app and new accommodation software. For more information, visit www.KAYAK.com.



As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a global network that includes OpenTable and KAYAK's portfolio of metasearch brands including Swoodoo, checkfelix, momondo, Cheapflights, Mundi and HotelsCombined. Many employees are dedicated to one brand, but we all have the benefit of using each others strengths and insights. Together, we're able to help people experience the world through dining and travel.



The Role:



KAYAK is seeking a highly-motivated Manager of Commercial Partnerships on our Flights team who will be helping our commercial activities in North America, building and maintaining business relationships with our existing partners who offer ancillary travel products. The candidate will also lead and implement a comprehensive ancillary revenue strategy. The ideal candidate has a strong partnership mentality with the ability to prioritize business objectives while balancing customer/partner needs. Candidates must be self-starters and able to thrive in an agile, fast-paced, and data-driven environment. An understanding of consumer behavior, strong analytical skills, and the ability to effectively communicate and influence KAYAK's internal partners across engineering, design, and business teams will be necessary for success. If you are a number's junkie who is passionate about business and technology, this might be the perfect role for you.



This position will report to the North America Director of Flights and would be based in Cambridge, Massachusetts, or Stamford, Connecticut. Occasional client travel is expected.


**In this role, you will:**

* Help design and implement a sustainable ancillary revenue strategy for KAYAK
* Build, negotiate, and maintain business relationships with flight partners and ancillary partners
* Have a passion for user-centric digital products, identifying and filling content gaps versus competitors
* Enhance existing relationships in terms of revenue generation and form new partnerships to benefit KAYAK's product and users.
* Analyze and monitor the performance of the content on KAYAK and partnerships with third parties.
* Develop strong relationships and work cross-functionally with the KAYAK commercial, product, and engineering teams.
* Measure product performance using business and user metrics, establish relevant reports.
* Monitor the competitive landscape of partners' content and develop strategies to provide KAYAK with the best content for our users.


**Please apply if:**

* 4 years experience in travel industry or related industry
* OTA / Agency / Distribution / Airline industry experience is a plus
* Excellent negotiator and target driven
* Highly proficient in Excel, PowerPoint
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills and presentation experience
* Embody the KAYAK ethos - Be Bold, Love Numbers, Win As One
* Meticulous, strong analytical and problem-solving skills required
* Ability to think creatively to investigate issues and provide solutions
* Ability to manage complex, nuanced relationships
* Proven track record of going above and beyond through outstanding project management
* Ability to manage projects of varying size and scope simultaneously while prioritizing appropriately
* Ability to develop new insights and work cross-functionally with team members to see projects through to completion
* Self-starter and ability to work independently
* Ability to effectively collaborate closely with both internal technical teams and senior members of the KAYAK commercial team
* Good sense of humor and loves working in an unstructured, fast-paced environment
* BA/BS degree required


**Benefits**


* Generous paid vacation
* Day off on your birthday
* Company matched retirement plans
* Health, dental and vision insurance plans
* Flexible Spending Accounts
* Headspace Subscription
* Drinks, coffee, snacks, games etc.
* Weekly Catered Lunches
* Free massages from professional massage therapists
* Universal Paid Parental Leave


Note **for Connecticut Residents**: To receive estimated salary range information for this role pursuant to Connecticut's "An Act Concerning the Disclosure of Salary Range for a Vacant Position", email CTCareers@kayak.com. You must include the name of the position in your request.



There are a variety of factors that go into determining a salary range, including but not limited to external market benchmark data, geographic location, and years of experience sought/required. The range for this United States located role is $90,000 - $110,000



In addition to a competitive base salary, roles are eligible for additional compensation and benefits including: annual cash bonus; health benefits; flexible spending account; retirement benefits; life insurance; paid time off (including PTO, paid sick leave, medical leave, bereavement leave, floating holidays and paid holidays); and parental leave and benefits.


**Diversity and Inclusion**



We aspire to have a workplace that reflects all of the diverse communities we serve. We know that when we have diverse teams we produce more creative ideas, products, and better outcomes for our team members. OpenTable/KAYAK is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we welcome and encourage candidates from all backgrounds and experiences to apply for roles on our team. Whoever you are, just be you.



We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

**Company Description**

Emax Financial & Real Estate Advisory Services, LLC (Emax) is a Women-Owned Small Business (www.emaxllc.com) providing expert real estate and program support services, capital markets services, and management consulting services to government, quasi-government and private entities. The company has been operating continuously since 1989, with offices in New York City and Washington D.C. Emax has established a track record for problem solving, flexibility, and execution, and employs individuals with more than 50 years of combined experience in real estate and finance.

Emax functions primarily as a federal real estate consulting firm, assisting government agencies such as the Department of Housing and Urban Affairs (HUD), Veterans Affairs (VA), Department of the Navy (DON) and the General Services Administration in portfolio and asset management, credit scoring and valuations, best use analysis, real estate and energy development, operational support, technology services and much more. While we are equipped to service private clients as well, our current focus is on federal agencies.

· Interested in real estate, asset management, operations, and financial consulting

description:
**Summary**

One-on-one Pilates studio specializing in clients with injuries and special populations seeks individuals for part-time employment or to join our sub list for temporary employment. Our studio specialties working with clients to bridge the gap between physical therapy and general fitness.

**Responsibilities**

* Teaching one-on-one Pilates sessions
* Early morning (7am), evening (to 9pm) and weekend session times are shared among all instructors. Exact teaching schedule is to be negotiated
* Minimal administrative work (i.e emailing with our scheduling manager, keeping studio tidy, filling out timesheets, using Mind Body Online software, zoom for virtual sessions)

**Qualifications**

* Certified on all equipment and mat
* 2-5 years of teaching experience in a fully equipped studio
* Ability to modify: Experienced with a rehabilitative approach as well as with providing fitness sessions to clients with injuries/special populations
* Be able to break down and explain what you are teaching to clients and why (help them learn, not just do)
* Strong understanding of anatomy and biomechanics

**Assets**

* Experience studying Alexander, Feldenkrais, yoga, dance, or other somatic modality
* Experience with some or all: seniors, clients with mobility issues, neuromuscular issues, osteoporosis, disc herniations, scoliosis, pre/post natal
* Punctual and reliable
* Friendly, motivational, wants to grow in and with the business

**Compensation & Benefits**

* $45/session + $18/admin tasks (i.e. emails, timesheets)
* $45-$405 Bonus for each client series renewal + referral\\*
* Wages paid via direct deposit on a bi-monthly basis
* $400/month Health Reimbursement Account\\*
* 401K with 4% match\\*
* Up to 5 days sick leave
* At-will employment

*\\*Please ask for details and qualifications at the interview.*

Email rebecca@dynamicbodypilates.com with resume and/or inquiries.
